Name: Four Mushroom Immune Complex 2oz.
Short description:
This blend of wildcrafted mushrooms is one of my award winning herbal formulas. It combines Chaga, Birch Polypore, Chicken of the Woods, and Turkey Tail. These mushrooms are wildcrafted in the woods of Vermont and New Hampshire. They are slow decocted in reverse osmosis maple tree water, before blending with organic cane alcohol and allowing to macerate for a month. This process extracts both the water soluble and alcohol soluble constituents.
\n
\nChaga mushrooms are a type of medicinal mushroom native to colder climates, like the Acadian forests in which we find ourselves. They are often consumed as a supplement due to their high concentration of antioxidants and other beneficial compounds. Some potential health benefits of Chaga includes immune system support, anti-inflammatory effects, and blood sugar control.
\n
\nBirch polypore mushrooms are a type of medicinal mushroom that also grow on birch trees. They are commonly used in traditional medicine and are thought to have immune-boosting and antiviral properties. Some research suggests that birch polypore mushrooms may have potential as a natural treatment for infections and chronic inflammation.
\n
\nChicken of the Woods mushrooms are a type of edible mushroom that gets its name from its poultry-like flavor. In addition to being a tasty addition to dishes, chicken of the woods mushrooms are also believed to have medicinal properties. Some research suggests that they may have anti-inflammatory and immune-boosting effects.
\n
\nTurkey tail mushrooms are a type of medicinal mushroom native to East Asia. They are commonly used in traditional medicine and are thought to have immune-boosting, antiviral, and anti-tumor properties. Some research suggests that turkey tail mushrooms may be helpful in the treatment of various conditions.
\n
\nAll of these mushrooms are decocted (simmered, cooked in our reverse osmosis maple tree water) and then tinctured with organic cane alcohol. This blend is then allowed to macerate for a month or longer before pressing and bottling.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Sweet Fern Cough Syrup 2oz.
Short description: Sweet Fern Cough Syrup \nAward Winner \n \nSweet Fern Cough Syrup is one of our award winning wildcrafted herbal formulas that blends the aromatic qualities of Sweet Fern and Wild Mint with the antispasmodic and expectorant properties of Lobelia. These herbs are extracted with organic cane alcohol and blended into a base of VT Honey, Apple Cider Vinegar, and Maple Syrup. This cough syrup is as delicious as it is effective! Take it straight to help soothe a cough or add to tea for a synergistic effect. \n \nSweet Fern \nSweet Fern, also known as Comptonia peregrina, is a plant native to North America that has been used for centuries by indigenous people for its medicinal properties. The plant is known for its unique aroma and is often used to make tea and other traditional remedies. Sweet Fern contains a variety of chemical compounds that are believed to be responsible for its medicinal properties. One of the most notable compounds found in Sweet Fern is called comptonin, which is a sesquiterpene lactone. Sesquiterpene lactones are a class of compounds that have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. Sweet Fern also contains other compounds such as flavonoids, which are known to have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Flavonoids also have been found to have anti-cancer effects, and it is believed that they may help to prevent the growth of cancer cells. The plant also contains essential oils, which are volatile compounds that give the plant its characteristic aroma. These oils are believed to have anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties, which may help to protect the plant from disease and pests. In addition to these compounds, Sweet Fern also contains a variety of minerals and vitamins, including iron, manganese, and vitamin C. These nutrients are believed to be important for overall health and well-being. \n \nLobelia cardinalis  \nLobelia cardinalis, also known as cardinal flower, is a plant native to North America that has been used for centuries by indigenous people for its medicinal properties. The plant is known for its vibrant red flowers and is often used to make traditional remedies. Lobelia cardinalis contains a variety of chemical compounds that are believed to be responsible for its medicinal properties. One of the most notable compounds found in Lobelia cardinalis is called lobeline. Lobeline is an alkaloid, a type of compound that is known to have medicinal properties. It has been traditionally used as a respiratory stimulant and expectorant, to help break up and expel mucus from the lungs. Lobelia cardinalis also contains other compounds such as flavonoids, which are known to have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Flavonoids also have been found to have anti-cancer effects, and it is believed that they may help to prevent the growth of cancer cells. The plant also contains essential oils which are volatile compounds that give the plant its characteristic aroma. These oils are believed to have anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties, which may help to protect the plant from disease and pests. In addition to these compounds, Lobelia cardinalis also contains a variety of minerals and vitamins, including potassium, magnesium and vitamin C. These nutrients are believed to be important for overall health and well-being. \n \nWild Mint \nMentha canadensis, also known as American Wild Mint, is a perennial herb native to North America. It has been used for centuries by indigenous people for its medicinal properties, and is known for its distinct minty aroma. The essential oil of Mentha canadensis is a rich source of various aromatic compounds, including menthol, menthone, and menthyl acetate. Menthol is the compound responsible for the characteristic minty aroma and cooling sensation of the plant, and it has been traditionally used as a decongestant, to help relieve nasal congestion. Menthol has also been found to have anti-inflammatory and pain-relieving properties. Menthone is another compound found in the essential oil of Mentha canadensis, it has a similar structure to menthol, and it is known to have a minty aroma and soothing properties. Menthyl acetate, is also found in the essential oil of Mentha canadensis, it is known for its minty and fruity aroma. It is used in perfumery and food industry. Mentha canadensis also contains a variety of flavonoids, which are known to have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Flavonoids also have been found to have anti-cancer effects, and it is believed that they may help to prevent the growth of cancer cells. \n \nThese three herbs taken together in a base of Vermont Honey, Apple Cider, Vinegar, and Maple Syrup, are a superb combination for chest congestion, stuffy nose, sore throat, and nagging cough. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Women's Daily Tonic 2oz.
Short description: A nourishing blend of shatavari, dong quai, schisandra, raspberry leaf, damiana, and rose to support women’s vitality and balance.
Description:
The Women’s Daily Tonic Tincture 2oz is a carefully crafted herbal blend designed to support women’s vitality, balance, and resilience. This formula draws on centuries of traditional herbal wisdom, combining adaptogenic, nourishing, and harmonizing plants.

\n

Shatavari, known as the “queen of herbs” in Ayurveda, has been treasured for centuries for its ability to support the female reproductive system. It helps maintain hormonal balance, supports natural fertility, and promotes vitality at all stages of life. Dong quai, often called the “female ginseng,” is used in Traditional Chinese Medicine to support menstrual health, improve circulation, and replenish energy.

\n

Schisandra berries bring adaptogenic benefits, helping the body respond to stress while supporting healthy liver function and enhancing vitality. Raspberry leaf, a classic women’s herb, gently tones and nourishes the uterus, offering support through all life phases. Damiana adds an uplifting, mood-balancing quality while promoting healthy energy and circulation. Rose petals offer a calming, loving influence for the heart and spirit, bringing emotional balance to the blend.

\n

Each herb is extracted in a 1:4 ratio to maximize potency and preserve the full spectrum of active constituents. We craft this tincture using a blend of organic cane alcohol, ROM maple water, and organic glycerine for a smooth, palatable flavor.

\n

Suggested use: Take 1.2ml (¼ teaspoon) one to three times daily in water, tea, or directly under the tongue.

\n

If you want to connect with any of these herbs as Simples, consider pairing the Women’s Daily Tonic Tincture with a Simple Schisandra Extract for additional adaptogenic benefits, Simple Damiana Tincture for mood and energy, or Simple Wild Rose for heart-centered wellness.

\n

Our Women’s Daily Tonic Tincture is handcrafted in small batches to ensure quality and freshness, using organic, wildcrafted, and ethically sourced ingredients whenever possible. It is designed to be a gentle yet powerful daily ally for women seeking to feel balanced, energized, and deeply nourished.

Name: Men’s Daily Tonic Tincture 2oz
Short description: Handcrafted herbal blend with wildcrafted saw palmetto, Vermont-grown ashwagandha, organic black maca, he shou wu, nettle root, clove, and balinese long pepper to support men’s vitality.
Description:
The Men’s Daily Tonic Tincture 2oz is a balanced herbal blend designed to support men’s vitality, stamina, and overall well-being. This formula combines some of the most respected herbs in traditional herbalism, each chosen for its unique role in male health.

\n

This tonic is the ideal everyday supplement for a man in today’s world. The saw palmetto berries were ethically wildcrafted on my father’s Florida property, offering high-quality support for healthy prostate function and urinary balance. Ashwagandha is organically grown in Vermont and helps the body adapt to stress while promoting endurance and balanced energy. We chose an organic black maca variety because black maca is reported to be the most potent of the maca types, supporting libido and physical performance. The nettle root, he shou wu, and clove are organically grown, while the Balinese long pepper is a wildcrafted variety prized for its warming and circulation-supporting qualities. Together, these botanicals create a superb male tonic.

\n

He shou wu, a treasured herb in Chinese medicine, nourishes the kidneys and supports vitality over time. Nettle root offers benefits for urinary health and hormone balance. Balinese long pepper adds a gentle heat to the blend, promoting circulation and digestive health. Clove provides antioxidant benefits and supports the digestive system.

\n

Each batch is crafted in small quantities and extracted in 30–40% organic cane alcohol to ensure potency and stability. The addition of ROM maple water.

\n

Suggested use: Take 1.2ml (¼ teaspoon) one to three times daily in water or directly under the tongue.

\n

For additional support, consider pairing the Men’s Daily Tonic Tincture with Hemp Adapt for stress resilience, Cordyceps Mushroom Extract for energy and stamina.

Name: Vermont Reishi Dual Extraction 2oz.
Short description: Vermont Reishi Dual Extraction 2oz. \n \nReishi is nicknamed "The Mushroom of Immortality". Every year we harvest the highest quality Reishi Mushrooms (Ganoderma tsugae) from the old growth woods in VT and NH. These mushrooms are delicately sliced and dried before they are decocted in ROM (reverse osmosis maple) water and then blended with organic cane alcohol. The tincture is allowed to macerate for at least one month before pressing in our hydraulic press. This tincture has a wonderful fungal flavor that delivers powerful immune support. If you prefer capsules, try our Reishi Capsules. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Whole Plant CBD Extract MCT Oil
Short description: We bring you the highest quality Vermont grown CBD oil at an affordable price. This high potency CBD oil delivers 25mg per 1/2mL dose. This hemp extract starts as an ethanol preparation (tincture) and is then refined in a rotary evaporator which allows for a better terpene extraction than supercritical. The concentrate is then blended with MCT oil (medium chain triglycerides) sourced from coconut oil, which is the ideal fat for optimal absorption. \n \nEach ½ mL dose contains 25mg CBD.  Shake Well before using. Take with a fat containing meal for best absorption.

Name: Pure Hemp CBD Tincture
Short description:
Vermont Grown Pure Hemp Extract \nTrue Full Spectrum

\nThis Hemp Extract is a true tincture, made with organic cane alcohol and the highest quality Cannabis grown by our friends at Vermont Botanical Farm, a local Vermont company dedicated to increasing the health of people, soil and the community through the use of local food systems, sustainable agriculture and cannabis.  \n \nThis extract is so much more than just "CBD". Our true whole plant tincture delivers 10mg CBD, but 30mg of total Hemp Extract. Hemp Extract means all the various Cannabinoids (but specifically CBD and CBDA) as well as terpenes, flavonoids, chlorophyll, and much more. All of these constituents work together in a synergistic fashion. Take the true tincture challenge and see the difference! \n \nThis product is a true full spectrum Cannabis tincture. Contains less than 0.3% THC. \n

Vermont Grown Pure Hemp Extract \nTrue Full Spectrum

\nThis Hemp Extract is a true tincture, made with organic cane alcohol and the highest quality Cannabis grown by our friends at Vermont Botanical Farm, a local Vermont company dedicated to increasing the health of people, soil and the community through the use of local food systems, sustainable agriculture and cannabis.  \n \nThis extract is so much more than just "CBD". Our true whole plant tincture delivers 10mg CBD, but 30mg of total Hemp Extract. Hemp Extract means all the various Cannabinoids (but specifically CBD and CBDA) as well as terpenes, flavonoids, chlorophyll, and much more. All of these constituents work together in a synergistic fashion. Take the true tincture challenge and see the difference! \n \nThis product is a true full spectrum Cannabis tincture. Contains less than 0.3% THC. \n \n[embed]https://youtu.be/MSePHMCzE9E[/embed] \n
As a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It is important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider.
\n

Name: Hemp Adapt 2oz.
Short description: Hemp Adapt is a handcrafted Vermont tincture with hemp extract, adaptogens, and nervines to promote balance, resilience, and calm focus.
Description:
A beloved favorite of many, Hemp Adapt by Rogue Herbalist is a carefully crafted artisanal tincture designed to support your body’s natural ability to adapt to stress, restore balance, and promote calm focus. This unique formula blends full-spectrum hemp extract (20mg per 1ml) with time-honored adaptogens and nervine herbs, creating a daily tonic that works in harmony with your mind and body.

\n

The hemp extract in this tincture offers a broad range of naturally occurring cannabinoids, enhancing your body’s endocannabinoid system to help regulate mood, sleep, and stress response. To this base, we add Ashwagandha, an adaptogenic root long revered for promoting steady energy and reducing the effects of stress. Reishi mushroom further enhances the adaptogenic profile, supporting immune health while calming the spirit.

\n

For mental ease and emotional grounding, Skullcap gently soothes the nervous system, while Tulsi (Holy Basil) uplifts mood and supports clarity. Together, these botanicals create a formula that is both grounding and invigorating, helping you meet life’s demands with resilience and grace.

\n

We craft Hemp Adapt in small batches, using ROM maple water and organic cane alcohol to preserve the full potency of each herb. Every bottle is made with care in Vermont, ensuring the highest quality from raw ingredient to finished product.

\n

For a complementary daily herbal approach, try pairing Hemp Adapt with our Schisandra Tincture for deeper adaptogenic support or our Reishi Mushroom Powder Extract for immune balance.

\n

Suggested Use: Take ~45 drops (1ml) daily or as directed by your herbal practitioner.

\n \n
As a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It’s important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider.

Name: Hemp Bitters 2oz.
Short description: A handcrafted tincture blending hemp extract, CBD, and aromatic digestive herbs for balanced daily wellness and gut support.
Description:
Hemp Bitters by Rogue Herbalist is a handcrafted tincture that blends premium hemp extract with a thoughtful selection of digestive-support herbs. This formula delivers 15mg of hemp extract and 5mg of CBD per 1ml, combined with the aromatic and balancing properties of angelica root, anise hyssop, chamomile, meadowsweet, and dandelion root. Each batch is made in Vermont using organic cane alcohol and our signature ROM maple water, creating a rich, complex herbal profile.

\n

Bitters have long been used to awaken digestion, stimulate appetite, and help the body better process nutrients. The hemp extract in Hemp Bitters adds a unique, grounding quality that complements the traditional herbal blend. Angelica root supports healthy digestion and circulation. Anise hyssop offers a naturally sweet, minty lift. Chamomile brings a calming effect to the stomach and mind. Meadowsweet helps maintain a balanced digestive environment. Dandelion root supports gentle liver function and overall detoxification.

\n

This artisanal formula can be taken before meals to prepare the digestive system or enjoyed after eating for a soothing finish. Hemp Bitters can also be added to sparkling water or herbal tea for a functional beverage that blends flavor with purpose.

\n

Hemp Bitters by Rogue Herbalist is made in small batches to ensure freshness and potency. Our herbal ingredients are either organically grown or ethically wildcrafted, and every bottle reflects our commitment to quality and care.

\n

For additional herbal digestive support, you may enjoy our Enhanced Probiotic or Ginger Tincture 2oz. For relaxation and stress balance, consider Hemp Adapt by Rogue Herbalist.

Name: Hemp Uplift 2 oz.
Short description: A mood-brightening tincture with hemp extract and uplifting adaptogens to support focus, balance, and daily vitality.
Description:
Hemp Uplift by Rogue Herbalist is a thoughtfully crafted tincture designed to support mood balance, mental clarity, and gentle energy. Each serving contains 20mg of hemp extract sourced from aerial parts of the plant, combined with a vibrant blend of rhodiola, tulsi, turmeric, rose, saffron, and vanilla. This unique herbal synergy is extracted in organic cane alcohol and enriched with our signature ROM maple water for a smooth, well-rounded flavor.

\n

Hemp extract provides a grounding, steadying influence, while rhodiola acts as a time-honored adaptogen to promote resilience under stress. Tulsi, also known as holy basil, helps maintain emotional equilibrium and calm mental chatter. Turmeric contributes to whole-body vitality and circulation. Rose lends a gentle, heart-centered warmth, while saffron offers a golden lift for mood and spirit. Vanilla rounds out the formula with a comforting aroma and taste.

\n

Hemp Uplift is ideal for those looking to support daily mood and focus without overstimulation. It can be taken in the morning to set a positive tone for the day or in the afternoon to maintain clarity and calm. Simply place ~45 drops (1ml) under the tongue or mix into a small amount of water or tea.

\n

Like all Rogue Herbalist creations, Hemp Uplift is made in small batches for maximum freshness and potency. We prioritize organic and ethically sourced ingredients to ensure a product that is as pure as it is effective.

\n

For complementary blends, you might enjoy our Hemp Adapt by Rogue Herbalist for stress resilience or Hemp Bitters by Rogue Herbalist for digestive wellness.

\n \n
As a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The flavor in this Canna Cordial is from REAL organic blueberry concentrate and Vermont maple syrup. But don’t be fooled! These blends still pack a powerful hemp punch, half as potent as our original VT Grown Pure Hemp Extract. \n \nAs a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It’s important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Hemp Immune 2oz.
Short description: Hemp Immune 2oz. \nThis unique blends combines our VT grown Hemp extract with VT grown Echinacea root, as well as Prickly Ash Bark, White Peony Root, Olive Leaf, and Clove buds. This formula is designed to support the immune system through endocannabinoid modulation. There are many medicinal herbs that have been found to have activity on the endocannabinoid system (ECS). The ECS is a complex network of receptors and neurotransmitters that is involved in various functions in the body, including pain, mood, appetite, and memory. The ECS receives and transmits signals from compounds called cannabinoids, which can be found naturally in the body or produced by plants. \n \nAs a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It is important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider.
Description:
Hemp Immune 2oz.
\n
This unique blends combines our VT grown Hemp extract with VT grown Echinacea root, as well as Prickly Ash Bark, White Peony Root, Olive Leaf, and Clove buds.
\n
This formula is designed to support the immune system through endocannabinoid modulation. There are many medicinal herbs that have been found to have activity on the endocannabinoid system (ECS). The ECS is a complex network of receptors and neurotransmitters that is involved in various functions in the body, including pain, mood, appetite, and memory. The ECS receives and transmits signals from compounds called cannabinoids, which can be found naturally in the body or produced by plants.
\n

Name: Barberry Root, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Barberry Root, Organic \nBerberis vulgaris \n \nBarberry is an invasive plant in some areas but that does not mean we shouldn't appreciate it. As a source of the yellow alkaloid Berberine, this plant is the subject of much research. Berberine is being studied for a broad range of applications; as an anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, for its applications in blood sugar regulation and cardiovascular protection. Most people think of the at-risk plant Goldenseal when they think of Berberine, but we try to promote other plants that are not at the same level of risk. Also consider Oregon Grape Root or tincture, which is another berberine containing plant. That being said, we do offer Goldenseal Leaf, as well as Goldenseal Tincture and Goldenseal Capsules \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Burdock Root, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Burdock Root, Organic \nArctium lappa \n \nBurdock is one of the all stars when it comes to being both a food and a medicine. The roots are called Gobo and cultivated as a vegetable in Japan. It is a renowned alterative (blood-purifier) that is mildly bitter with a hint of sweetness. Name: Propolis Tincture 1oz.
Short description:
Propolis Tincture 1oz.
\n
\nPropolis is the tree resin that bees use to coat their hives. The word literally means "for the health of the city" and indeed it does keep the beehive clean and protected from bacteria and viruses. It is a very strong antimicrobial. It can be used topically on cuts and wounds. It is indicated for bronchitis, pneumonia, and other respiratory infections. Take 30 drops in water or juice, 1 - 3 times daily, or as directed by a healthcare professional.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

\nSlippery Elm is considered Demulcent, Emollient, Nutritive, Astringent, Anti-tussive, and Vulnerary. \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Simply put 1 or 2 drops of essential oil on the end of a Q tip and swab the tooth and gum around the affected area. Keep in mind it is spicy but it will help to numb the pain of a toothache.
\n

Name: Hawthorn Berries, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Hawthorn Berries, Organic, 1oz. bag \nCrataegus monogyna \n \nHawthorn berries are the classic cardiotonic. The perfect nourishing food for the heart, blood vessels, veins, and capillaries. In Chinese Herbal Medicine, Hawthorn is also used for stagnant digestion, helping to resolve food stagnation. These berries can be brewed as a decoction (simmered) in a crockpot and drank regularly, or they can be powdered, tinctured, or made into jelly when they are fresh. Often I will recommend brewing a strong batch in a crockpot and drinking regularly. Please note that Hawthorn Berries will sometimes develop a white film on the berry. This is natural sucrose maturing in the outer skin. You can also take Hawthorn tincture. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Jiaogulan, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Looking for a stimulating, caffeine-free tea that's packed with medicinal properties? Look no further than Jiaogulan, a powerful adaptogenic tea sourced from the small farming communities in Northern Thailand. With its sweet taste and numerous health benefits, it's no wonder that Jiaogulan is often referred to as "The Herb of Immortality". \n \nJiaogulan contains a class of compounds called gypenosides that are responsible for its impressive health benefits. These compounds are structurally similar to the ginsenosides found in Panax ginseng, which is another plant commonly used in traditional medicine. With over 80 gypenosides identified in Jiaogulan, it has more medicinal saponins than Panax ginseng, and is believed to have a variety of beneficial effects on the body. \n \nResearch suggests that ginsenosides may help improve cardiovascular health, lower blood pressure, reduce the risk of heart disease, and have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. They have also been studied for their potential to improve cognitive function, enhance immune function, and have anti-cancer effects. \n \nTo brew a perfect cup of Jiaogulan tea, boil pure water and cool to 150F (65C). Rinse leaves with a small amount of water, pour 8oz (250ml) of water over 1 teaspoon of leaf, and steep for 3-10 minutes. Jiaogulan tea is sold in 1oz. quantities, and you can purchase multiple ounces by adding multiple quantities. \n \nPlease note that these statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration, and this product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Be sure to consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine. Try Jiaogulan today and experience the numerous benefits for yourself! We also offer Jiaogulan Tincture!

Name: King Solomon’s Hemp Salve by Rogue Herbalist – 2 fl oz
Short description: King Solomon’s Hemp Salve combines Solomon’s Seal, CBD-rich hemp, and frankincense for powerful topical relief. Ideal for joints, muscles, tendons, and ligaments.
Description:
King Solomon’s Hemp Salve by Rogue Herbalist is a handcrafted, small-batch topical designed to support the body’s natural healing process. Made with Solomon’s Seal, high-CBD hemp flower, organic virgin coconut oil, frankincense essential oil, organic unrefined jojoba oil, and local Vermont beeswax, this formula brings the power of traditional herbal wisdom into modern wellness.

\n

Solomon’s Seal is revered for its ability to support connective tissue health, ease musculoskeletal discomfort, and aid in recovery from injuries. When paired with CBD-rich hemp flower and Frankincense, it creates a synergistic blend that works deep into the tissues, offering targeted relief for joints, tendons, ligaments, muscles, and bones. The frankincense essential oil adds a warm, soothing aroma while providing its own time-honored benefits for reducing discomfort and promoting circulation.

\n

We craft our hemp salve using carefully sourced ingredients, ensuring that every jar offers purity, potency, and consistency. As a broad-spectrum hemp extract, this salve contains CBD along with more than 80 other beneficial cannabinoids. By law, hemp products contain less than 0.3% THC, but trace amounts may still be present.

\n

Apply topically to areas of chronic or acute discomfort. Whether you’re managing everyday muscle tension or recovering from overuse, King Solomon’s Hemp Salve is a trusted herbal ally.

\n

For additional musculoskeletal support, explore our tinctures, which you can ingest for a whole body, systemic anti-inflammatory and healing experience. Name: Nigella Seed, Organic 1oz. bag
Short description: Nigella Seed, Organic 1oz. bag \nNigella sativa \n \nNigella Seed, also known as Black Seed or Black Cumin, is a powerful source of the phytochemical thymoquinone. This herb is a carminative (helps dispel gas & bloating) as well as a strong supporter of a healthy immune system. It is warm and dry and a circulatory stimulant. Similar to Fennel and other carminative seeds, this herb is also a galactogogue (helps produce mother's milk). It is often claimed that the Prophet Muhammad (Peace be Upon Him) himself declared “Black seed oil to be the greatest medicine of them all. He also said, Black Cumin heals every disease except for death”. While we would never make such a claim, it is interesting that this herb has been revered for so many hundreds of years. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. Name: Rhodiola Tincture 1oz.
Short description: Rhodiola Tincture 1oz. \nRhodiola rosea \n \nRhodiola is a powerful adaptogen that has been studied for its ability to make us better able to deal with stress. It has a long history of use in Siberia, Scandinavia, and Tibet to promote energy and protect against respiratory disorders; also used today to improve immunity, enhance exercise and protect the heart against stress-induced damage. It is well known to improve athletic performance and focus. As far as adaptogens go, it is more on the stimulating side, so I prefer to reserve it for times of need when I know I will be doing intense physical labor or exercise, or if I need to focus intensely on a project. This tincture is standardized to a minimum 3% rosavins. Serving size: 30 Drops (1ml) Suggested Use: 30 Drops in water or juice, 1 - 3 times daily, or as needed. We also offer Rhodiola capsules. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Elecampane Root, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Elecampane Root, Organic, 1oz. bag \nInula helenium \n \nElecampane is a wonderful choice for respiratory complaints, specifically chronic coughs, asthma, and bronchitis. It is also quite bitter and has a tonic effect on digestion. The root is a source of the prebiotic fiber Inulin which helps feed the flora in our GI tract. It is also incorporated into many parasite formulas because of its vermifuge quality. Steep one ounce in a pint of boiling water for twenty minutes and drink one cup three times daily. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Mugwort, Organic, Vermont Grown 1oz. bag
Short description: Mugwort \nArtemisia vulgaris \n \nMugwort is an aromatic shrub that has a bittersweet flavor and exerts a calming effect on the nervous system. The bitter quality aids the liver in digestion, helping with stomach and intestinal problems. Being an Artemisia, Mugwort is also anthelmintic, meaning it helps to kill parasites/worms. Mugwort is a strong emmenagogue and can be used to induce menses, therefore it should not be taken while pregnant. Mugwort is the herb that is used to make Moxa, for the practice of Moxabustion, which is the burning of the plant material and using the heat on parts of the body. This technique is often applied in combination with acupuncture. Also consider trying our Mugwort Tincture. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Enhanced Super Digestive Enzymes & Probiotics 60 caps
Short description: Enhanced Super Digestive Enzymes & Probiotics 60 caps \n \nThis vegetarian-friendly digestive health formula is good for anyone trying to up their intake of hard-to-digest veggies, legumes, fruit, or leafy greens. It contains a scientifically formulated blend of digestive enzymes, as well as a beneficial probiotic strain to help maintain healthy GI balance. \n \nDigestive enzymes break down food. But not every enzyme works on every nutrient: alpha galactosidase helps digest legumes and cruciferous vegetables (Notorious for causing abdominal bloating & discomfort) protease 3.0 helps digest proteins, and lipase helps digest fat. These digestive enzymes work in a variety of pH conditions. This is important, because different parts of your gastrointestinal tract (stomach, intestines, etc.) have different pH levels—which can also affect digestion. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: Specially-Coated Bromelain 500mg 60 tabs
Short description:
Specially-Coated Bromelain 500mg 60 tabs \n \nBromelain, a mixture of proteases extracted from the stem of the pineapple, inhibits inflammatory factors to support joint health. Bromelain’s fluid-regulating properties may result from its ability to inhibit inflammatory cytokine production, inhibit neutrophil migration and more. \n
    \n
  • Inhibits inflammation to support joint health
    • \n
  • Supports joint comfort & function
    • \n
  • Supports healthy blood viscosity
    • \n
\nSpecially-coated bromelain may significantly inhibit inflammatory reactions to support joint health. Research has demonstrated that enteric-coated bromelain formulations are at least as effective as other approaches in supporting joint comfort, function & health. One clinical study found that bromelain is more effective than other methods for maintaining joint function at rest. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

One clinical study found that bromelain is more effective than other methods for maintaining joint function at rest. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: Vitamin D-3 25mcg (1000iu) 250 softgels
Short description: Vitamin D-3 25mcg (1000iu) 250 softgels \n \nVitamin D is called the sunshine vitamin because your skin manufactures it when exposed to sunlight, but that shouldn’t be your only source. A vitamin D supplement goes a long way. We recommend about 125 mcg (5,000 IU) to 200 mcg (8,000 IU) of vitamin D3 a day. If your multivitamin already delivers 25-75 mcg (1,000–3,000 IU) of vitamin D, vitamin D3 125 mcg (5,000 IU) is perfect for achieving optimal levels. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: Melatonin 3mg 60 lozenges
Short description: Melatonin 3mg 60 lozenges \n \nMelatonin is a hormone derived from the amino acid tryptophan. Primarily synthesized in your pineal gland, melatonin is released mostly at night to make falling asleep easier. In addition to healthy sleep support, melatonin can help inhibit oxidative stress to promote healthy brain function, immune health and more. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine 600mg 60 caps
Short description:
N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine 600mg 60 caps \n \nAs a dietary supplement, N-acetyl-L-cysteine supports bronchial and respiratory health—it also encourages healthy immune cells. NAC is a chemical precursor to glutathione, which is a powerful antioxidant that protects cells from oxidative stress. This includes your delicate neurons. \n
    \n
  • Powerful antioxidant that promotes healthy glutathione levels
    • \n
  • Supports immune, bronchial & respiratory health
    • \n
  • Encourages liver health & function
    • \n
\nN-acetyl-L-cysteine is an easily-absorbed nutrient with potent benefits for whole body health.1 N-acetyl-L-cysteine also helps replenish your body's supply of glutathione. N-acetyl-L-cysteine and glutathione have powerful antioxidant effects, helping to protect cells like vulnerable nerve cells in your brain from free radicals.2-5 N-acetyl-L-cysteine also defends against insults from foreign compounds at the cellular level.6,7 \n
\n \nN-acetyl-L-cysteine is a potent nutrient that supports healthy respiratory function as well as bronchial health. It encourages healthy liver function and promotes immune system health. And more than 30 placebo-controlled studies on cellular glutathione suggest that N-acetyl-L-cysteine supplementation can favorably affect energy production, well-being and quality of life. \n \nEach capsule of our N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine contains 600 mg of this potent, rapidly absorbed nutrient. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. \n \n

Name: Gamma E Mixed Tocopherols & Tocotrienols 60 softgels
Short description:
Gamma E Mixed Tocopherols & Tocotrienols 60 softgels \n \nVitamin E is a family of eight related, lipid-soluble, antioxidant compounds widely present in plants. The tocopherol and tocotrienol subfamilies are each composed of alpha, beta, gamma and delta fractions that have different biological activity. \n
\n

Gamma E Mixed Tocopherols & Tocotrienols Benefits

\n
\n
\n
    \n
  • Provides potent antioxidant protection
    • \n
  • Encourages healthy platelet activity
    • \n
  • Promotes a healthy nervous system & retina of the eye
    • \n
  • Maintains healthy cognitive function
    • \n
  • Supports healthy immune function
    • \n
\nStudies have shown that the gamma-tocopherol form of vitamin E is especially important for those seeking optimal health benefits. But the combination of alpha- and gamma-tocopherol supplementation appears to be superior to either tocopherol alone on biomarkers of oxidative stress and other whole-body health factors. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. \n \n

Name: Mega Vitamin K2
Short description:
Mega Vitamin K2 30 capsules \n \nVitamin K (specifically vitamin K2) encourages the cellular activity of osteoblasts—specialized cells that regulate the mineralization of your bone matrix, the lattice-like support structure that bone is built upon. This helps maintain healthy bone density. And clinical studies show that 45,000 mcg of vitamin K2 as menaquinone-4 is especially effective. \n \nHealthy bone mineral density is dependent on vitamin K2, which helps encourage mineralization of your bone matrix. \nMega Vitamin K2 High Potency for Strong Bones Benefits \nEncourages bone-building cell activity \nPromotes healthy bone mineral density \nSupports cardiovascular health by helping to inhibit vascular calcification \nHelps you get your daily dose of hard to find K2 menaquinone-4 \nBone density loss over time \nDuring development, your bones go through a growth phase until they reach a peak bone mass where remodeling and upkeep occurs. But, this process begins to decline naturally over time and leads to age-related bone density loss. But studies show that the right kind of vitamin K2 (menaquinone-4), in the right dose, can help maintain healthy bone density. \n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Caution
If you are taking anticoagulant or antiplatelet medications, or have a bleeding disorder, consult with your healthcare provider before taking this product.
\n
\n
\n
\n
Warnings
\n
    \n
  • KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN
    • \n
  • DO NOT EXCEED RECOMMENDED DOSE
    • \n
  • Do not purchase if outer seal is broken or damaged.
    • \n
  • When using nutritional supplements, please consult with your physician if you are undergoing treatment for a medical condition or if you are pregnant or lactating.
    • \n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. \n \n
\n

Name: Cold & Flu Away Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Cold & Flu Away Herbal Honey \n \nIngredients: Raw Honey, Hyssop (Hyssopus officinalis), Osha (Ligusticum porteri), Yerba Santa (Eriodictyon californicum), Boneset (Eupatorium perfoliatum), Prickly Ash (Zanthoxylum clava-herculis), Licorice (Glycyrrhiza glabra) \n \nWhether a viral or bacterial infection, this formula supports the immune system to combat pathogens while at the same time easing the common symptoms of colds and flu, such as fever and upper respiratory discomfort (sneezing, coughing, sore throat). This balanced formula highlights Boneset, an indispensable herb for easing a fever while supporting its’ important process for healing. Our Osha root is strictly sourced from a well-known herbalist and expert wild-harvester and is used in smaller quantities due to its’ status in the wild. \n \n

Name: Moon Light Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Moon Light Herbal Honey 6oz. \n \nIngredients: Raw Honey, Cramp bark (Viburnum opulus), Black haw (Viburnum prunifolium), Peony (Peonia lactiflora), Licorice (Glycirrhiza glabra), Wild Yam (Dioscorea villosa), Dong Quai (Angelica sinensis), Jamaican Dogwood (Piscidida erythrina), Ginger (Zingiber officinalis) \n \nFor women with moderate to severe cramps, having an antispasmodic ready-made remedy on hand can be a life-saver. This is a tried and true formula for even more severe cramps, potent enough for regular small doses to be effective for most cramping. We created this formula to offer women a yummy and easy way to ease or stop cramping without having to take a regular, monthly dose or more of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDS).

Name: Root Beer Liver Tonic Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Root Beer Liver Tonic Herbal Honey 6oz. \n \nIngredients: Raw Honey, Red Root (Ceanothus americanus), Milk Thistle (Silybum marianum), Dandelion (Taraxacum officinalis), Sassafras (Sassafras albidum), Sarsaparilla (Smilax ..), Birch (Betula pubescens), Burdock (Arctium lappa), Oregon Grape (Mahonia aquifolium), Ginger (Zingiber officinale), Fennel (Foeniculum vulgare), Licorice (Glycyrrhiza glabra), Buplurum (Bupleurum chinense), Bitter Orange Peel (Citrus aurantium), Orange Peel (Citrus sinensis) \n \nWe live in a world that bombards our systems with an overabundance of toxins and other substances to process through our detoxification systems. In addition to proper sleep, good daily movement, a healthy diet and proper vitamin and mineral levels, herbal medicines that assist the liver and gallbladder are such a gift to offer the body on a regular basis. Our Root Beer Liver Tonic works to support the lymphatic, hepatic and digestive systems. With Milk Thistle as one of the primary actors in this formula, the protection and health of your liver is of utmost importance- it sure does a lot for you!

Name: Peaceful Mind Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Peaceful Mind Herbal Honey 6oz. \n \nIngredients: Raw Honey, Gotu Kola (Centella asiatica), Brahmi (Bacopa monnieri), Passionflower (Passiflora incarnata), Tulsi (Ocimum sanctum), Calamus (Acorus calamus) \n \nA peaceful mind is a harder thing to find these days. For those seeking support in meditation or simply throughout their busy days, this blend of Ayuervedic herbs traditionally used to prepare one for deeper meditative states, is deliciously combined with the wonderful adaptogen Tulsi or Holy Basil. Tulsi helps to buffer the negative effects of stress while building resilience. These herbs work together to calm the chatter, worry and busyness of the mind and help to bring us into a state of internal peace.

Name: Nailin' The Coughin' Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Nailin' The Coughin' Herbal Honey 6oz. \n \nIngredients: Wild Cherry Bark (Prunus spp.), Elecampane Flower (Inula helenium), Horehound (Marrubium vulgaris), Mullein (Verbascum thaspus), Peppermint (Mentha pepperita), Licorice (Glycyrrhiza glabra) \n \nAlso consider our Bronchial Syrup. \n \nCough herbs come in all shapes and sizes, so to speak. Some work for wet cough, some for dry; some work to produce expectoration, some work to decrease it to some degree. This formula is energetically balanced and amenable to most types of cough, working well for both the wet and dry cough. The Wild Cherry Bark is a great friend to help one sleep through the night while Elecampane, Horehound and Mullein work to keep the flow of movement out during the day all the while supporting the immune system to fight infection and move the body through illness faster.

Name: Flower Power Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Flower Power Herbal Honey 6oz. \n \nIngredients: Raw Honey, Chamomile (Matricaria recutita) ,Linden (Tilia spp.), Lemon Balm (Melissa officinalis), Motherwort (Leonarus cardiaca), Lavender (Lavendula angustifolia), Rose (Rosae rugosa) \n \nA lovely, calming balm for the nervous system, Flower Power brings together some of the most well-known flower nervines (Lavender, Rose, Chamomile, Linden), all encircling Motherwort, a prominent nervine here, providing an embrace of warmth and strength, like a big motherly hug, promoting relaxation and peace within.

Name: Activated Charcoal Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Activated Charcoal Herbal Honey 6oz. \n \nIngredients: Raw Honey, Activated Charcoal, Cultivated Goldenseal (Hydrastis canadensis) \n \nActivated charcoal is commonly used as a highly adsorbent, carbon material and eliminator of toxins; it is used in hospitals for some drug and alcohol overdoses, extracting the venom from insect bites and stings and for pathogenic infections in the gut, often experienced as ‘traveler’s diarrhea’ or food poisoning.  While it is no replacement for follow-up treatment for pathogenic exposures, it can alleviate symptoms and assist in removing some of the bacteria and toxic by-products. Great for splinters, cleansing facial masks, bites or stings or internally to speed along the recovery from food poisoning and many gastrointestinal infections. Extra water must be consumed along with activated charcoal; take 2 hours apart from food or medications if ingesting.

Activated Charcoal Herbal Honey 6oz.

\nIngredients: Raw Honey, Activated Charcoal, Cultivated Goldenseal (Hydrastis canadensis)

A popular honey with children of all ages, this honey not only supports the entire body, but tastes absolutely delicious, a sweet-tart medicinal treat!

Name: Happy Belly Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Happy Belly Herbal Honey 6oz. \n \nIngredients: Raw Honey Chamomile (Matricaria recutita) Calendula (Calendula officinalis) Plantain (Plantago officinalis) Marshmallow root (Althea officinalis) Fennel (Foeniculum vulgare) Peppermint (Mentha peperita) Meadowsweet (Filipendula ulmaria) Agrimony (Agrimonia eupatoria) Cardamom (Elettaria cardamommum) Burdock (Arctium lappa). \n \nConsider adding this honey to Chamomile Tea or another pleasant tasting carminative. \n \nDigestion is the root of our tree of health. When digestive discomfort presents itself, it is helpful to provide support with bitters or carminative herbs such as fennel, cardamom and peppermint, to ease pain and support the digestive process; when discomfort becomes chronic, it is very important to provide gastrointestinal tract healing as appropriate, which is needed more often than not by most people in our society. This formula highlights fantastic wound-healing and anti-inflammatory botanicals that are an essential part of any gut healing protocol. Burdock root is also added as a highly beneficial food for our microbiome while also supporting the hepatic system. For digestive discomfort, take recommended dose as needed; for gastrointestinal healing, take 2-3 doses daily. Pairs well with Pot of Gold for inflammatory digestive symptoms.

Name: L-Glutamine Powder 3.53oz.
Short description:
L-Glutamine Powder 3.53oz. \n \nGlutamine supplements are often associated with serious athletes, but it can be beneficial for anyone who wants to not only maintain muscle health, but also immune and specifically gut health. Anyone dealing with Leaky Gut should be aware of L-Glutamine. \n \nGlutamine can be found circulating in the blood, as well as stored in the skeletal muscles and liver, in concentrations ranging from 10- to 100-fold higher than any other amino acid. \n \nGlutamine is utilized in a number of vital functions, including protein synthesis and production of the nucleotide units that make up DNA and RNA. Because of its importance in many cellular functions, glutamine is consumed at especially high rates during activities involving intense exercise. It is an important energy source for cells lining the gut and immune cells and critical for healthy gut and immune function. It is also a precursor of the brain neurotransmitter glutamate. \n
\n

L-Glutamine Powder Benefits

\n
\n
\n
    \n
  • Supports healthy muscle mass
    • \n
  • Helps maintain energy levels under heavy stress
    • \n
  • Helps maintain optimal immune function & gut health
    • \n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. \n \n

Name: Ashwagandha Liquid Extract 1oz.
Short description: Ashwagandha Liquid Extract 1oz. \n \nWithania somnifera \n \nAshwagandha is a “Rasayana” or rejevunating adaptogenic herb which has been used in Ayurveda for centuries. This herb is ideal for those who are low energy, dealing with poor sleep or fatigue. Note the latin “somnifera” is akin to “insomnia” which indicates it is useful for sleep problems. Take 1ml in a little water, juice or tea, up to 3 times per day. We also offer a larger 2oz. Ashwagandha tincture. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Short description: Devil's Claw Liquid Extract 1oz. \nHarpagophytum procumbens \n \nThis bitter root is anti-inflammatory, antirheumatic, and analgesic. It is primarily used for arthritis, tendonitis, back pain, and general rheumatism. Due to its bitter action it can be used to promote appetite and digestion of fats. Name: Dong Quai Liquid Extract 1oz.
Short description: Dong Quai Liquid Extract 1oz. \nAngelica sinensis \n(also known as Dang Gui or Tang Kuei) \n \nAlso known as "Women's Ginseng" in Chinese Medicine, this root is a powerful blood tonic. It helps build the blood and move the blood as a circulatory stimulant. It is considered a uterine tonic, making it useful for irregular menses, painful periods, as well as menopause. It helps to lubricate the intestines and is mildly laxative in larger doses. Because it is emmenagogue, it is contraindicated in pregnancy. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Although there are different blends, this Essiac blend is the classic combination of Burdock Root, Sheep Sorrel, Slippery Elm Powder, and Turkey Rhubarb Root. Name: Chelated Zinc Elderberry Umckaloabo 4oz.
Short description:
Chelated Zinc - Elderberry Umckaloabo 4oz.
\nAlcohol Free
\n
\nThis tasty liquid Zinc supplement delivers 15mg Zinc Glycinate in a 1 teaspoon dose. Zinc Glycinate is the mineral Zinc that has been chelated (bound) to the Glycine amino acid, making the mineral more absorbable and gentler on the gastrointestinal tract. The word chelated (kee-late-ted) comes from the Greek word chela, which means "Claw". An easy way to remember this idea is to imagine the Zinc has "claws" that stick into the Glycine amino acid. This bioavailable form of the mineral is more like how minerals are found naturally in food sources, making it better absorbed. This syrup also delivers Elderberry and Umckaloabo, as well as Echinacea and a bit of Stevia for sweetness. This combination provides powerful immune support.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Gentian Tincture 1oz.
Short description: Gentian Tincture 1oz. \nGentiana lutea \n \nOrganic Gentian Root is considered to be a "pure bitter" and is the classic bitter herb used in Angostura Bitters and other classic cocktail recipes. It is classified as a digestive bitter, hepatic, cholagogue, choleretic, emmenagogue, a mild sialogogue, febrifuge, anthelmintic, antimicrobial, and hypoglycemic. Specifically it is used for people with sluggish liver, lack of appetite, poor digestion, cramping, gas and bloating, nausea, vomiting, heartburn, and even allergies. Do not use if you are a pregnant or breastfeeding woman. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

\n

\nLipo-Cmax™ 1000 mg

\n
\nNon-GMO
\n

Name: Calamus Root, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Calamus Root, Organic, 1oz. bag \nAcorus calamus \n \nCalamus is a bitter root that is also known as Sweet Flag. It is the original ingredient in Calamine Lotion and can be used topically for skin irritations, but it is also an incredible herb for acid reflux and indigestion. You can simply chew on a piece of root, or drink some of the bitter tea and it has a remarkable effect on the digestion. In Ayurveda, the root is considered to have a powerful effect on the throat as well as the mind. For more information, read this article by Karta Purkh Singh Khalsa. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. Name: Cascara Sagrada Bark, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Cascara Sagrada Bark, Organic, 1oz. bag \nRhamnus purshiana \n \nThis aged bark is a mild laxative that affects the colon, spleen, stomach, and liver. The bitterness stimulates the digestive secretions of the gastrointestinal system including the liver, gallbladder, stomach, and pancreas. It is considered one of the safest tonic-laxative herbs and can be used on a daily basis for chronic constipation if necessary. It is also useful for colitis, hemorrhoids, liver failure, and jaundice. \n \n  \n \nPrecautions \nNot for use in pregnancy or lactation except under the supervision of a qualified healthcare practitioner. Contraindicated with intestinal obstruction, abdominal pain, or any inflammatory condition of the intestines. Not for use in excess of 8 days unless under the supervision of a qualified healthcare practitioner. We recommend that you consult with a qualified healthcare practitioner before using herbal products, particularly if you are pregnant, nursing, or on any medications. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.

Name: Celery Seed, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Celery Seed, Organic, 1oz. bag \nApium graveolens \n \nCelery Seed is a carminative seed that is helpful with gas, bloating, and indigestion. It is a powerful diuretic that aids the kidneys in cleansing the body of excess fluids and uric acid. For this reason Celery Seed is often found in products that help with gout. However, it is important to be cautious if you have kidney problems. \n \nPrecautions \nIf using in therapeutic doses then not for use in pregnancy except under the supervision of a qualified healthcare practitioner. Name: Chaste Tree (Vitex) Berries, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Chaste Tree (Vitex) Berries, Organic, 1oz. bag \nVitex agnus-castus \n \n  \n \nMateria Medica – Vitex \nVitex angus-castus \nVerbenaceae family \n \nMonk's pepper \nNative to Mediterranean temperate to tropical, US zone 6 \nDeciduous shrub \nLeaves opposite, 5-7 radiating lanceolate leaflets \nFlowers white to purple \nSeeds dark purple \n \nSource: Widely available, calyx on outside of berry \nBerries are constantly falling from tree, collect with a large tarp, white sheet \nStarts from Milk & Honey herbs in Mass \nPrune back branches in autumn \n \nTaste: bitter, spicy \nEnergetics: Warming and drying but also cooling, allows it to be a balancer of the hormones \n \nWarm: \nMoves Blood/Stagnation Emmenagogue \nMoves Qi Vulnerary \nPhlegm/Damp stagnation \n \nCool: \nBitterness increase secretion Galactogogue \nLiver Qi stagnation \n \nIndications- \nReproductive: \nCramping \nHormonal imbalances \nAmenorrhea, Dysmenorrhea, Leukorrhea \nFibroids, Cysts \nPCOS \nEndometriosis \nCan use with heavy or light cycles (balancing) \nDuring perimenopause \nClient who is stressed, poor diet \n \nMary Bove – many problems result from Luteal phase deficiency \nMost valuable during latter part of cycle \nGreat herb to use if client is going off the pill – use all the way through the cycle \nCycle related acne \nMenopausal related – vaginal dryness, nervous system \nFor infertility that results from deficiency – need to rebuild before getting pregnant \nDopaminergic can be used for withdrawal symptoms – Paul Bergner \nChemistry: \nKey Constituents: Iridoid glycosides (aucubin, agnuside); Diterpenes (otundifuran, vitexilactone); Flavonoids (casticin, vitexin, isovitexin, kaempferol); EO \n \nCasticin acting on the pituitary gland via the dopaminergic pathways, reduces the release of prolactin, this can correct progesterone deficiency \nProlactin plays a role in fertility, inhibits FSH and GnRH (hormones that trigger ovulation), also plays a role in milk production \nProlactin inhibits libido, increases milk production \nIncreases corpus luteum and corrects progesterone deficiency usually. \n \nAntitumor action (softening) of the iridoid glycosides \n \nFlavonoids are working with pituitary gland. \n \nWithdrawal from the pill: headaches, mood (anger), skin outbreaks, bloating/weight gain, flow, infertility, joint pain \n \nSafety:  Safety Class: 1, Interaction Class: A \nNo known studies on safety in pregnancy \n \nDosage: \nTincture: Dried berries (1:5, 45% alcohol) 1-3 ml (0.2 - 0.6 tsp.) 3 times daily \nCapsule or powder: 1-2g  TID \nInfusion: Pour 1 cup boiling water over 1tspn and infuse 10-15 min.  Drink 3X daily \n \n  \n \nCombinations: \nBlood stag: Black Cohosh, Cramp Bark, Cinnamon, \nBlood deficiency: Dong Quai, (watch for stagnation) \nLiver Qi stagnation (outbreaks, angry hormonal): Dandelion root, Burdock, Yellow Dock, Milk Thistle, Bupleurum, Artichoke \nPhlegm (Cysts, Fibroids): Cinnamon, Ginger, Poria, White Peony, Dandelion \n \n  \n \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Clove Buds, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Clove Buds, Organic, 1oz. bag \nSyzygium aromaticum \n \nCloves are one of the most delightful spices. Reminiscent of Christmastime, this herb is not just a simple toothache remedy! The oil of clove will help numb a toothache via the chemical constituent eugenol which has a numbing effect (this is the same chemical used in Orajel). The Japanese Samurai used to put bags of cloves all over their bodies to ward off evil spirits. Clove is spicy, sweet, warming, and soothing to the digestion. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Ghost Pipe Tincture
Short description: Ghost Pipe Tincture \nMonotropa uniflora \n \nGhost Pipe is truly a "plant spirit medicine" if there ever was one. Also known as 'Indian Pipe' or the older name 'Fit Root' (as in epileptic fits), this plant has the unique ability of helping us step outside of our pain, whether that pain is physical, emotional, or spiritual. In the 1939 classic book Back to Eden, Jethro Kloss writes about Monotropa uniflora. He describes it as antispasmodic, nervine, tonic, sedative, and febrifuge. According to Kloss: "Is splendid in all kinds of fevers. Takes the place of quinine and opium. An excellent remedy for restlessness, fainting, nervous irritability, muscle spasm, and convulsions. Should be used in place of opium and quinine. It will cure intermittent and remittent fevers. Oh, why will not people use this wonderful remedy in place of poisonous drugs? It is efficient and harmless. A teaspoonful of fit root and fennel seed, steeped in a pint of boiling water for twenty minutes, is an excellent douche for inflammation of the vagina and uterus, also good used as a wash for sore eyes. A valuable remedy for epilepsy and lockjaw in children". (pp. 128) \n \nThe modern term is "Antinociceptive" is derived from nociception; the perception of pain. It does not dull pain like a common analgesic, but rather it allows us to step outside of our pain and not be consumed by it. Contemporary herbalists tend to use it more for PTSD and trauma induced ailments. \n \nThe tincture that I make is small batch and only made once a year. I only harvest the aerial portions of the flowering plant and tincture them fresh at a 1:1 herb to menstruum ratio in a blend of organic cane alcohol and reverse osmosis maple tree water. Start with low dose on this plant, a few drops goes a long way. Take up to a dropperful at a time as needed. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine. \n \n

Name: Devil's Claw Root, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Devil's Claw Root, Organic, 1oz. bag \nHarpagophytum procumbens \n \nDevil's Claw is a powerful bitter root that comes from Africa. It is a member of the sesame family and derives its name from the hooked fruits that it grows. The bitterness of this plant makes it a powerful digestive stimulant, but it is also well known for it's anti-rheumatic properties. I have personally used it in formulas with great success. Also consider our Devil's Claw tincture. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.

Name: Fenugreek Seed, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Fenugreek Seed, Organic, 1oz. bag \nTrigonella foenum-graecum \n \nFenugreek is a sweet tasting carminative that is pungent, bitter, and warming. These properties help relieve gas and bloating and also go well in immune formulas. It is a galactogogue, which means it supports the production of breast milk in nursing mothers. Conversely, the phytosterols in Fenugreek are also considered to support healthy testosterone levels in men. Fenugreek is generally nutritive and has a maple-like flavor, making it a good addition to teas. We also offer a Fenugreek Tincture. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.

Name: Fennel Seed, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Fennel Seed, Organic, 1oz. bag \nFoeniculum vulgare \n \nFennel is my go to herb for gas, bloating, and indigestion. It is incredibly safe for children and adults. It is considered stomachic and carminative. It has expectorant properties. It has mild bitterness that gently stimulates the liver. It is galactogogue which means it helps promote the production of breast milk. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Fo-Ti Root (He Shou Wu) , Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Fo-Ti Root (He Shou Wu) , Organic, 1oz. bag \nPolygonum multiflorum \n \nFo-Ti (also known as He Shou Wu) is the tuber of a Chinese flowering vine. According to the traditional preparation, the Fo-Ti roots are cured in a black bean sauce. The herb is sweet and bitter in taste, warming and moistening in action.  According to legend this nourishing tonic helped restore the potency of Mr. He. The translation of He Shou Wu literally means "Mr. He's Black Hair". While this herb may not turn your hair black, it does possess a regenerative tonic effect that improves weakness of lower back and knees. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.

Name: Goji Berries, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Goji Berries, Organic, 1oz. bag \nLycium barbarum \n \nGoji Berries (also referred to as Lycii Berries or Wolf Berries) are in the nightshade family and are generally regarded as a "superfood" in the western world. In Chinese Herbalism they are considered to be a Yin Tonic, cooling and nutritive, they bring nourishment and moisture into the body. The dried berries make an excellent tea and snack if you reconstitute them with hot water; eaten like this they will bring more moisture into the gastrointestinal system and can be helpful with constipation. The moisture helps increase vaginal secretions and can also support dry, cracking joints or an achy back (kidney). These little berries are full of carotenoids (Vitamin A) which is one reason they are extremely good for the eyes, as well as the heart, kidneys, and the liver. One nickname for this plant is "Matrimony Vine" because it is also considered to be good for the libido, and indeed modern research shows this to be the case. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only \n \n

Name: Maca Root Powder, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Maca Root Powder, Organic, 1oz. bag \nLepidium meyenii \n \nMaca is a root crop from Peru that is used as a nutritious food as well as an adaptogenic herbal medicine. It has many virtues for the hormonal system, helping both men and women. The powder is ideal to add to smoothies, porridge, breads, and more. According to Inca mythology, the god Viracocha, who is considered the creator god and ruler of the universe, gave Maca to the people as a gift. The Incas believed that consuming Maca would give them strength, endurance and vitality, thus it was considered a sacred plant. Maca was also used in traditional Inca medicine to help with a variety of ailments, including infertility and impotence. The Incas believed that consuming Maca would enhance sexual function and fertility. The flavor is sweet, malty, and nourishing. Also try our Maca tincture. \n \nOver the past several years there has been concern about low quality Chinese Maca flooding the market. Make sure your Maca is from South America! \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Milk Thistle Seed, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Milk Thistle Seed, Organic, 1oz. bag \nSilybum marianum  \n \nMilk Thistle Seed is probably one of the best known remedies for the Liver. However, it is important if you are buying the whole seeds to grind them and take them whole in a smoothie, not as a tea. The constituents you are looking for are not water soluble so the entire seed must be consumed fresh ground or as a tincture or extract capsule. Also try our Milk Thistle Tincture. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.
