Name: Red Sage Root (Dan Shen), Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Red Sage Root (Dan Shen), Organic, 1oz. bag \nSalvia miltiorrhiza \n \nRed Sage is known as Dan Shen in Chinese Medicine. It is a member of the mint family, but unlike culinary sage, the part being used is the root. It is one of the most outstanding herbs for cardiovascular health. Michael Tierra claims that it is "even more effective for angina than hawthorn".  \n \nMateria Medica – Dan Shen, Red Sage root, Red Salvia \nSalvia miltiorrhiza - Dan Shen \nS. przewalskii - Dan Shen gansu (far more hardy) – appearance is more like Clary Sage \nDifferent names for different parts of the plant. \nLamiaceae (Mint) family \n \nID: Dark green leaves, huge flowers that are fused tubes, sticky, has a lot of resin, especially on the calyx, doesn't smell despite the fact it is a mint. \nHerbaceous, perennial, medium sized, large flowers \n \nRoot is deep purple/red, doctrine of signature for the Blood and Cardiovascular. \n \nPart used: Root \n \nSource: Chinese medicine commerce, Native to China, Southeast Asia \n \nGrow: Quite easy to grow, doesn't take long to get fully matured roots. Likes warm and bright during germination. Can be hit hard by VT winter (use Mulch). \n \nCan Harvest on the first season, but grown in VT it likely will not be optimal. Pharmacological research suggests you can harvest at 9 months old, but VT doesn't have 9 months of growing, so best to wait 2 or more seasons. By the fall of the second year. \n \nTaste: Pungent, Bitter, Sweet, slightly bitter, slightly astringent \nVipaka (post digestive effect) is warming \n \nEnergetics: Cool → Cold, Moving or Diffusive, Dry \n \nActions: \nBlood Mover \nAnti-coagulant \nAnti-inflammatory \nEmmenagogue \nNeuroprotectant, Neuroregenerative \nAnti-spasmodic \nAnti-bacterial (E. Coli, Staph, Cholera, Pseudomonas) → in the gut or topical \nSome see it as an alterative as it helps move waste products out. \nHepatic \nHypotensive (goes w/ the antispasmodic activity) \nSedative (gentle effect) – similar to Baikal Skullcap in that way. \nGood for “active, angry, anxious” folks \nHypocholesterolemic – excess cholesterol is created by the liver as a band aid for the lining of the epithelium, but the inflammation is the real culprit. Changing the cholesterol numbers is a bonus effect of reducing the inflammatory burden. \n-It has been referred to as an adaptogen, but is not really connected to the HPA axis in the way that a classic adaptogen is... \nCardiotonic \n \nClinical Uses: CARDIOVASCULAR \n- excess Heat, inflammation of the cardio system \n- extreme manual labor, cigarette smoker, air pollution, pesticides, stress \n- all the inflammatory byproducts of local inflammation goes to the Blood and Heart :( \n- the endothelium is very fragile \n- preventive use as a long term tonic \n- high blood pressure, atherosclerotic, clottiness (a tendency to coagulate via inflammation) \n- myocardial infarction, heart attack \n- help people recover from heart attack, stroke \n- repair the damage the results from hypoxia (no oxygen to the epithelium) \n- TBI, neuroregenerative effect, transient ischemic attack (mini stroke) \n- Cold hands & feet, Raynaud's \n- Palipitations (bitter, mint family, cold, blood mover) where there is anxiety, irritability \n- Blue Vervain has a similar symptom picture \n- Eye Health, Kidney, Nerves, peripheral, anywhere there are capillaries to be nourished \n- In diabetes where the microcirculation is impaired due to inflammation \n- Cardiometabolic – via diabetes or pre-diabetes \n- Deficient Blood that results in Blood stagnation \n- like w/ Motherwort or Blue Vervain, it can move too quickly and create a collapse \n- important to also build if you are going to use for Blood deficiency \n- Blood stagnation = Pain \n- if you have pain, you want a Blood mover \n \nNERVOUS SYSTEM \n-Any kind of brain inflammation, Stroke, TIA, post aneurysm \n-protects nerve cells and promotes brain circulation (blood brain barrier) \n-Lyme \n-Prevention of Alzheimer's \n-Any kind of neurodegenerative inflammation, Parkinson's, inflammation to nerve cells \n-Mood – stuck, hot, depression, anxiety, panic (not the cold person), angry, irritable (Pitta), lethargic, people who are normally accomplishing \n-Emotion can be stored in parts of the body, pelvis, heart, shoulders \n \nIMMUNE, etc \n-affinity for the Liver, where there is Liver inflammation \n-Hepatitis \n-any time there is inflammatory pain \n-has some activity with Kappa Opioid receptor, related to addictive behavior (possible modulation?) \n-many types of cancer, often unfolds from inflammatory processes, particularly breast cancer \n-protect the Liver from chemical assaults \n-Liver is the Mover of the Blood! \n-Hot, Stuck person w/ Heart or Brain inflammation \n-Reproductive stuff, reducing clottiness, pain, spasm, menstruation, energy stagnation in pelvis \n-Delayed Menses \n \n  \n \n  \n \nConstituents \nditerpenes: \ntanshinone IIA \nsalvinorin A \ncryptotanshinone \nmiltirone \n \norganic acids \nrosmarinic acid \nlithospermic acid (more common in boraginaceae family) \n \nbioflavonoids \nrutin \nquercetin \nhesperidin \n \nanthroquinones – may have some anthroquinones – not confirmed \n \nPotential uses extrapolated: \nAddiction – alcohol use – miltiorone has been studied as an inhibitor of excess alcohol consumption \nhelps to deal with toxic effect of alcohol on Liver and Brain \nCancer \n \nClinical Research \n \nAkaberi M1, Iranshahi M2, Mehri S3. Phytother Res. 2016 Jun;30(6):878-93. doi: 10.1002/ptr.5599. Epub 2016 Mar 14. \nMolecular Signaling Pathways Behind the Biological Effects of Salvia Species Diterpenes in Neuropharmacology and Cardiology. \n“effects on the benzodiazepine and kappa opioid receptors and neuroprotective effects” \n \nOxid Med Cell Longev. 2016;2016:4797102. Epub 2016 Oct 11. \nOxidative Stress and Salvia miltiorrhiza in Aging-Associated Cardiovascular Diseases. \n“reduces the impact of ischemia/reperfusion injury, prevents cardiac fibrosis after myocardial infarction, preserves cardiac function in coronary disease, maintains the integrity of the blood-brain barrier, and promotes self-renewal and proliferation of neural stem/progenitor cells in stroke.” \n \nZhong Nan Da Xue Xue Bao Yi Xue Ban. 2010 Apr;35(4):358-64. doi: 10.3969/j.issn.1672-7347.2010.04.013. \n[Therapeutic effect of the combination of traditional Chinese medicine and western medicine on patients with oral submucous fibrosis]. \n \n  \n \nSafety: No contraindications in pregnancy in lactation but if the woman has risk of miscarriage then maybe consider something else. \n \nChinese do not consider it to be contraindicated in pregnancy, have used in high BP in pregnancy \n \nContraindicated w/ anti-coagulant drugs \nseen in practice \n \nSome people say that it might be thyroid suppressing. Lithospermic acid may decrease thyroid function (theoretical). \n \nDosage: If recovering from heart attack, TBI, etc. then use: 6 – 15 grams dried root decocted \n \n3 – 5ml of tincture BID, TID @ 1:3 ratio 60 – 65% using dried herb \n \nDon't use immediately after TBI. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.

Name: Rhodiola Root, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Rhodiola Root, Organic, 1oz. bag \nRhodiola rosea \n \nRhodiola is a powerful adaptogen that has been studied for its ability to make us better able to deal with stress. It is well known to improve athletic performance and focus. As far as adaptogens go, it is more on the stimulating side, so I prefer to reserve it for times of need when I know I will be doing intense physical labor or exercise, or if I need to focus intensely on a project. Also try our Rhodiola tincture. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Schisandra Berries, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Schisandra Berries, Organic, 1oz. bag \nSchisandra chinensis \n \nSchisandra is the famous five flavor berry from Traditional Chinese Medicine. Schisandra berry is known as the "five-flavor berry" because it is said to have all five flavors: sour, sweet, bitter, pungent, and salty. The chemical composition of the berry is complex; it contains multiple compounds that give it a unique taste profile. It is adaptogenic, nervine, hepatoprotective, and circulatory stimulant. It is indicated for weak lungs, digestion, liver and immune system. It helps the body hold onto moisture and therefore it is an ideal herb for night sweats. This is one of my favorite herbs. It also is a delicious and fast acting tincture. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Description:
Elevate your cold- & flu-season routine with our handcrafted Elderberry Syrup—a potent, delicious blend designed to support immune resilience and seasonal wellness.

\n

We craft this small-batch syrup using fresh and dried local elderberries and elderflowers, enhanced with immune-nourishing echinacea root, adaptogenic reishi, astragalus, warming ginger, cinnamon, and clove, all balanced with Vermont honey, apple cider vinegar, and pure maple water.

\n \n

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    Versatile Use: Take it straight, stir it into tea, or drizzle it over pancakes or yogurt.

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    Quality Ingredients: All botanical components are organic and either locally grown or ethically wildcrafted for maximum potency and purity.

    \n
    • \n
\n

Suggested Use: Take one teaspoon daily as part of your wellness routine; increase to 2–3x per day during heightened seasonal stress or mild respiratory symptoms.

\n

Safety Note: Contains honey and apple cider vinegar—please consult your healthcare provider if you are pregnant, on blood sugar–lowering medication, or have an autoimmune condition. Not intended to diagnose, treat, or replace medical advice.

Name: Motherwort Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Motherwort Tincture 2oz. \nLeonorus cardiaca \n \nThis Motherwort tincture is made in house from freshly harvested Motherwort flowers and leaves. The fresh aerial portions are put into the food processor and then tinctured at a 1:4 strength in 70% organic cane alcohol and reverse osmosis maple water. Motherwort is ideal for those experiencing anxiety, cardiovascular palpitations, delayed menses, poor sleep, nervousness, grief, or a broken heart. It is bitter, spicy, and cooling. It is considered to be emmenagogue (stimulates menses), cardiac tonic, antispasmodic, nervine, diuretic, and carminative.  Take 1 dropperful in water or juice, up to 3 times daily. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Optimized Tryptophan Plus 90 veg caps
Short description:
Optimized Tryptophan Plus 90 veg caps
\n
\nOptimized Tryptophan Plus provides 1,000 mg of high-quality L-tryptophan per serving to promote a healthy mood, help support optimal sleep and support a healthy stress response. Many people prefer using tryptophan combined with its essential cofactors lysine and niacinamide in lieu of 5-HTP. Tryptophan is better able to remain stable in the blood and cross the blood-brain barrier, where it is converted to serotonin. If 5-HTP converts to serotonin in the blood, this serotonin will not cross the blood-brain barrier. Do not combine with pharmaceutical SSRI's or MAOI's.
\n
\nSupplement Facts
\nServing Size 3 vegetarian capsules
\nServings Per Container 30
\nAmount Per Serving
\n
\nNiacin (as niacinamide)
\n66 mg•
\n
\nL-Tryptophan
\n1000 mg
\n
\nL-Lysine (as L-Lysine HCl)
\n250 mg
\n
\nProprietary Tryptophan Plus Blend
\n285 mg
\nPerluxan® Hops standardized extract (cones), Rosemary standardized extract (leaf)
\n
\nOther ingredients: vegetable cellulose (capsule), microcrystalline cellulose, vegetable stearate, hydroxypropyl methylcellulose, silica, maltodextrin, modified food starch.
\n•NE (niacin equivalents).
\nNon-GMO
\nPerluxan® is used by permission.
\n
\nDosage and Use
\nTake up to three (3) capsules all at once before bedtime, or one capsule on an empty stomach before each meal, or as recommended by a healthcare practitioner.
\nFor maximum absorption take with a small amount of carbohydrate, such as diluted juice.
\nBest if taken separately from protein or amino acids.
\nCaution
\nSerotonin syndrome is characterized by high levels of serotonin and symptoms like confusion, sweating, agitation, nausea, involuntary muscle contractions, and racing heartbeat. Do not take L-tryptophan if you experience these symptoms. Because tryptophan may have numerous drug interactions (most commonly, MAOIs and SSRIs) consult your healthcare provider before taking this product if you are taking prescription medications. Do not use before driving or operating heavy machinery.
\n
\nWarnings
\nKEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN
\nDO NOT EXCEED RECOMMENDED DOSE
\nDo not purchase if outer seal is broken or damaged.
\nWhen using nutritional supplements, please consult with your physician if you are undergoing treatment for a medical condition or if you are pregnant or lactating.

Name: Ashwagandha Powder, Organic 1oz. bag
Short description: Ashwagandha is one of the premier adaptogenic tonics. Ashwagandha powder is taken for a variety of reasons. It is one of the more nervine adaptogens, meaning that it is not overly stimulating but rather provides nourishment for the nervous system. For this reason it is ideal herb for rebuilding. Can be used to improve energy levels but also helpful with restful sleep. This plant is also considered a sexual tonic for both men and women. More and more evidence continues to show that Ashwagandha may boost serum testosterone.  Perfect to add to smoothies or beverage of your choice. Consider taking Arjuna alongside other cardiovascular tonics, such as our Turmeric Plus Heart Complete with CoQ10 Powder Capsules. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Cat's Claw Powder, Wildcrafted, 1oz. bag
Short description: Cat’s Claw, Wildcrafted \nUncaria tomentosa \n \nCat’s Claw is the inner bark of a vine from South America that contains a plethora of valuable chemical constituents. Cat’s Claw has the following properties: anti-inflammatory, antirheumatic, antioxidant, antiviral, antitumor, antimicrobial, contraceptive, cytostatic, and immune tonic. The indigenous people of the Amazon use it for a wide variety of applications including headaches, colds, flus, fevers, and particularly gastrointestinal uses like colitis, irritable bowel, Crohn’s and ulcers. It is thought that Cat’s Claw helps detoxify the gastrointestinal tract. Cat’s Claw is also part of the Buhner Lyme Protocol and should be considered when building a protocol for Lyme. Also consider taking our Cat's Claw tincture. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Eleuthero Root Powder, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Eleuthero root powder, Organic \nEleutherococcus senticosus \n \nEleuthero root is sometimes incorrectly referred to as “Siberian Ginseng” although it is not a true ginseng at all. However, it does possess similar adaptogenic qualities to ginseng. It is one of the original adaptogens, having been studied by the Russians for athletic performance and endurance training. Many people are not aware of Eleuthero but it is truly a wonderful adaptogenic herb that has a plethora of research behind it. Add the powder to smoothies or mix into bliss balls. Also consider our Eleuthero tincture. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. Name: Olive Leaf Powder, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Olive Leaf and Fruit have been used as food and medicine for centuries. The leaf is bitter and can be used as a tea for minor fevers, nervous tension, most commonly used for lowering blood pressure (avoid use if you have hypotension). It helps modulate inflammation and combats viruses making it a great choice for an immune formula. This powder can be used in a variety of ways, or consider taking our Olive Leaf Tincture or our Olive Leaf Capsules. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. Name: Mullein Leaf, Wildcrafted or Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Mullein is a common weed that acts as a powerful expectorant and demulcent for respiratory complaints. It soothes inflamed passageways of respiratory and urinary passageways. Helpful with dry coughs and hoarseness. V. thapsus contains a wide variety of phytoconstituents, such as flavonoids, iridoid, phenylethanoid and phenylpropanoid glycosides, saponins, as well as vitamin C and minerals. The most valuable constituents are coumarin and hesperidin, which possess healing properties. It has a mild action on the lymphatic system and can be combined with stronger lymphatic herbs. Take Mullein Leaf as a tea or consider taking our Mullein tincture. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Lime Basil, Organic, Vermont grown 1oz. bag
Short description: Our Lime Basil is organically grown by Foster Farm Botanicals in East Calais, Vermont. It is a strain of culinary Basil but has particularly notable zesty citrus taste and aroma. It is ideal in teas and tinctures as a carminative that helps relieve gas and bloating, while also supporting healthy immune function. Because it is so well known for its culinary purposes, people forget that Basil has an abundance of research behind it.   Although a different species of Ocimum, you should also consider trying our Holy Basil capsules. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. Name: Wormwood Tincture 1oz.
Short description: Wormwood Tincture 1oz. \nArtemisia absinthium  \n \nWormwood is a strong bitter herb with a great deal of history behind it. It is anthelmintic (meaning it kills parasites), antimicrobial, antiviral, antifungal, the list goes on. Energetically it is cold, bitter and acts upon the liver and gallbladder, making it an ideal herb to aid in digestion. Take 30 drops in water or juice, 1 - 3 times daily, or as needed. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Yellow Dock Tincture 1oz.
Short description: Yellow Dock Tincture 1oz. \nRumex crispus \n \nYellow Dock is a bittersweet root with cool energy effecting the liver and colon. It is considered a cholagogue, alterative, a blood tonic, and most notably a mild laxative. Because of its blood cleansing properties, Yellow Dock is used for chronic skin ailments such as acne, eczema, psoriasis, and other skin eruptions. It is also found in blood building formulas due to its rich iron content. We also offer Yellow Dock in bulk. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Blue Vervain Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Blue Vervain Tincture 2oz. \nVerbena hastata \n \nWe wildcraft our Blue Vervain at the peak of it's potency and then process it fresh with organic cane alcohol and reverse osmosis maple water. Vervain is a powerful nervine, meaning that it is used to promote a state of calm. For this reason it is helpful with anxiety, insomnia caused by a busy mind, and is especially helpful for those who worry constantly! It has a bitter taste which also makes it useful for the digestive tract (the brain and gut are connected remember). \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Japanese Knotweed Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Japanese Knotweed Tincture 2oz. \nReynoutria japonica \n \nThough considered an invasive scourge by some, Japanese Knotweed is an incredible medicinal herb that grows all over Vermont and beyond. Most notably, Japanese Knotweed is one of the commercial sources of the renowned "Red Wine" molecule Resveratrol. In addition to this, Japanese Knotweed finds a place in the Buhner Lyme Protocol as a neuroprotectant and more. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Jiaogulan Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Jiaogulan Tincture 2oz. \nGynostemma pentaphylum \n \nJiaogulan (Jee-ow-goo-lahn) is a lesser known adaptogen but it should be at the top of everyone's list. Although it is not a true Ginseng, it is called "Southern Ginseng" because it is an adaptogen quite similar to Ginseng. Not only that, it is a much more sustainable crop than Ginseng. Not only does it make an amazing tea, but this tincture is sweet, delicious, energizing, focusing, and enriches your vitality. We source the highest quality organic Jiaogulan from Northern Thailand and tincture at a 1:3 strength in organic cane alcohol and reverse osmosis maple water. The research on Jiaogulan is remarkable and I encourage everyone to learn more about this amazing adaptogen. Jiaogulan is a powerful adaptogenic tea from the small farming communities in Northern Thailand. It is in the Ginseng family and has a very similar sweet taste. It is stimulating and focusing without being caffeinated. “The Herb of Immortality” Try it! \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Maitake Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Maitake Tincture 2oz. \nGrifola frondosa \n \nAlso known as "Hen of the Woods" this mushroom is known as Maitake by the Japanese who considered it so valuable that they used to trade it for its weight in silver. Indeed this mushroom is valuable, as it is a choice edible as well as a powerful medicinal. Contemporary research shows Maitake to have benefits for the blood sugar, cardiovascular system, and of course the immune system. We work with Tamias Wildcrafting in Williamstown, VT to bring you this dual extracted Maitake extract. Vermont harvested Maitake is carefully dried and then decocted in reverse osmosis maple water before tincturing with organic cane alcohol. We allow the extract to macerate for at least a month before pressing and bottling. The resulting extract is a delicious and potent wild medicinal. We hope you enjoy it as much as we do. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Mugwort Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Mugwort Tincture 2oz. \nArtemisia vulgaris \n \nWe wildcraft this Mugwort and tincture it fresh in with organic cane alcohol and reverse osmosis maple water. Mugwort is in the family Artemisia (same family as Wormwood, Sweet Annie, and Tarragon, among others) and brings with numerous healthful properties. It is bitter, although not nearly as bitter as Wormwood, and has a familiar sweetness as well. It promotes a healthy digestive system and is also an excellent nervine. Take 1 - 2 dropperfuls in water, juice or tea. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Spilanthes Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Spilanthes Tincture 2oz. \nAcmella oleracea \n \nLocally grown and organic Spilanthes is tinctured fresh at peak potency in 95% organic cane alcohol. Spilanthes is also known as "toothache plant" because of the numbing effect that it has on the mouth. Take a dose and you can feel the fatty acid amide known as spilanthol causing a tingling, numbing sensation in the mouth. The plant also has a wide array of anti-microbial action, making it an ideal herb to take for cold or flu. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Tulsi 'Kapoor' Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Tulsi 'Kapoor' Tincture 2oz. \nOcimum sanctum \n \nTulsi is also known as Holy Basil or "The Incomparable One". It is a plant with sweet notes of bubblegum and spicy notes of oregano or basil. Tulsi is revered in India and considered to be adaptogenic and carminative. Many people take Tulsi for it’s broad anti-inflammatory effect but it also has significant calming and stress relieving properties. It’s delicious too! Take 1ml in a little water, juice or tea, up to 3 times per day. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Herbalism Through the Seasons - Five Element Workshop Series
Short description: We are very excited to announce the launch of a five-part series featuring Chuck Riffenburg, owner of Rogue Herbalist and Dr. Joshua Corn, Naturopathic Doctor at Stowe Natural Family Wellness. This series of workshops will take us through the seasons as we study herbalism and the human body through the lens of traditional energetics, as well as contemporary science. You may purchase the classes as a series or individually but you will receive a discount if you purchase the full series.  \n \nSpring - Liver, Gallbladder, and Detoxification Workshop \nApril 1st, 2023 \nJoin us as we delve into the natural processes of detoxification and learn about herbs and foods that support healthy detoxification. You will also have the opportunity to make your own herbal tea and detox juice! \n \nSummer - Cardiovascular System and Rosewater Distillation \nJune 10th, 2023 \nIn this class, we will explore the cardiovascular system and the herbs and foods that sustain a healthy heart. This class will coincide with our annual Rosewater Distillation workshop. Participants will take part in the rose harvest and learn about the distillation process. Everyone will take home a bottle of Rosewater! \n \nLate Summer - Digestive System and Local Plant & Mushroom Walk and Picnic \nSeptember 9th, 2023 \nIn this class, we will meet off site and go for an Herb & Mushroom Walk. We will identify various plants and mushrooms, and the class discussion will revolve around the digestive system. Please bring a backpack, hiking boots, water, and any food you may want for the picnic. You may also want to bring a pen and paper to take notes. \n \nAutumn - Respiratory and Immune System - Fire Cider Making \nOctober 21st, 2023 \nThis class will focus on the Lungs and the Immune System, and making Fire Cider is the perfect activity to go with this theme! We will provide the various ingredients (organic apple cider vinegar, honey, ginger, garlic, peppers, etc.) that is needed to create your own Fire Cider. \n \nWinter - Kidneys & Bladder - Tea Making \nJanuary 6th, 2024 \nThe cold season is perfect for tea making, so join us as we study the Kidneys and Bladder. We will drink tea as you discover the finer points of blending an herbal tea and take home your very own creation. \n \n***Please be aware, because of the amount of time and energy that goes into planning a series like this, there are no refunds available on a workshop purchase. Please do not purchase if you will be unable to attend the event. If you miss the event, you will not be refunded.***

Name: Pot of Gold Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Ingredients: Raw Honey, Turmeric (Curcuma longa), Pipali long-pepper (Piper nigrum) \n \nTurmeric is famous as an incredibly powerful, anti-inflammatory medicinal; however, many people to not know just how protective this herb is for the liver and how supportive it is for the nervous, endocrine and immune systems. Enjoy Pot of Gold mixed into warmed milk for a ready-made golden milk; stir into hot water or just take by the spoonful, which most people do, it is that good!

Name: Breathe Easy Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description: Raw Nevada County Honey Nettle (Urtica dioica) Chamomile (Matricaria recutita) Yerba Santa (Eriodictyon spp.), Ginger (Zingiber officinalis) Licorice (Glycyrrhiza glabra) \n \nFor those who suffer from the common, uncomfortable symptoms of season allergies, a runny nose, runny eyes, headaches, fatigue and other symptoms, Breathe Easy can provide relief in those challenging  days. As one of the best natural anti-histamine botanicals, Nettle leaf is the chief herb in this formula, supported by other allies to help calm the immune response while addressing and decreasing the specific symptoms.

Name: Lemon Balm Tincture 1oz.
Short description:
Lemon Balm Tincture 1oz.
\n
\nThe herb is considered sour, spicy, and cool. The properties of Lemon Balm are diaphoretic, calmative, antispasmodic, carminative, emmenagogue, and stomachic. Name: Comfrey Root, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Comfrey Root, Organic, 1oz. bag \n \nComfrey gets a bad name for a particular constituent known as Pyrrolizidine alkaloids (PAs), but this constituent is found in other plants as well and is really only harmful in super high doses. These alkaloids are more potent in the roots, but are also present in Comfrey Leaf. While some studies have suggested that the PAs in comfrey may be harmful, others have found that the herb is safe when used in small amounts and for short periods of time. While it is recommended that Comfrey only be used topically, this is a matter of great debate among herbalists. The dried herb can be used in poultices for sore muscles, broken bones, stiff joints, and other musculoskeletal complaints. We also have a Comfrey Liniment for topical use. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nWe plant Comfrey in our herb garden around the edges of the porch and building. It is a wonderful plant in permaculture as it helps to pull up minerals from the soil and then the leaves can be used as a "green manure". They provide a beautiful ground cover as well as nourishment for the pollinators. However, be aware that certain types of Comfrey are fast spreading and could take over your garden if you let it. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Dandelion Root, Roasted, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Roasted Dandelion Root, Organic, 1oz. bag \nTaraxacum offinale \n \nRoasted dandelion root has a long history of being used as a coffee substitute, particularly during times of economic hardship or coffee shortages. Dandelion root has a similar appearance and texture to coffee beans and when roasted, it develops a similar flavor profile. During World War II, for example, coffee was rationed and dandelion root was often used as an alternative. The practice of using dandelion root as a coffee substitute dates back even further, with some sources claiming that it was used during the American Civil War and in the Great Depression. \n \nDandelion root coffee is made by harvesting the roots of the dandelion plant, washing and drying them, roasting them until they are dark brown and then grounding them. The resulting powder can be used to brew a beverage that is said to have a similar taste to coffee. Some people claim that dandelion root coffee is less bitter and has a slightly sweeter taste than traditional coffee. Dandelion is high in antioxidants, minerals and inulin, a type of soluble fiber. We also offer local Dandelion Root from Foster Farm Botanicals as well as Dandelion Tincture. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Ancient Forest Tea, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Ancient Forest Tea, Organic, 1oz. bag \n \nOrganic Ancient Forest is harvested from ancient tea plants in the Yunnan province of China. These Ancient Tea Plants range in age from 500 to 2,700 years old! These tea forests help support biodiversity because they are often grown in the forests to supply homes for birds and insects, which help to keep pests under control and protect against erosion. \n \nThis ancient forest tea has an earthy and nuanced flavor profile, which is unlike any other black or green tea on the market. Bold, dark, and inviting; ancient forests tea is robust and earthy tea with subtly sweet notes. \n \nContains caffeine. \n \nAroma and Flavor \nWith fragrant hints of rich soil and malt, the smooth taste of this tea has a heavy finish and little tannin. \n \nBrew Instructions \nFill 1 teaspoon of tea in a cloth tea bag or mesh basket and place in your favorite mug. Pour 8 ounces of boiling water over the tea and allow to steep for 3-5 minutes. Experiment with steep time and quantity of tea and find your ideal cup! \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Lapsang Souchong, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Lapsang Souchong, Organic, 1oz. bag \n \nThis organic lapsang souchong tea is a dark and smoky black tea which has been gently smoked over pine bark and needles, producing an amazing smoked flavor. This tea is grown in Fujian Province of China. \n \nMy favorite way to serve this tea is with cream or milk and a bit of Vermont maple syrup. Contains caffeine. \n \nAroma and Flavor \nThe aroma of this black tea is robust, with smoky and earthy notes. Name: Guayusa, Organic, 1oz.
Short description: Guayusa, Organic, 1oz. bag \n \nGuayusa tea is the dried leaves of a South American rainforest holly which is a close relative to yerba mate and yaupon. The indigenous cultures of Ecuador simmered guayusa leaves in water and sipped the tea for its stimulating effect, referring to it as "Night Watchman". Guayusa has a full-bodied green taste that has a slight grassy character. \n \nShade grown guayusa leaves are nutritious and tastier compared to sun grown guayusa. This difference is obvious just by glancing at the color of the dried material. Shade grown guayusa such as ours is a bold dark green, while the sun grown leaves are much paler and are lacking in flavor. \n \nContains caffeine. \n \nAroma and Flavor \nA slight grassy aroma with a full-bodied green flavor. \n \nBrew Instructions \nFill 1 teaspoon of tea in a cloth tea bag or mesh basket and place in your favorite mug. Pour 8 ounces of boiling water over the tea and allow to steep for 3-5 minutes or until desired strength is reached.

Name: Chicory Root, Raw, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description:
Chicory Root, Raw, Organic, 1oz. bag
\n
\nChicory is a perennial plant that is native to Europe and parts of Asia. It has been used for centuries as a food and medicinal plant. The roots of the plant can be roasted and ground to make a coffee substitute or additive, and the leaves can be eaten raw in a salad or cooked as a leafy green. In traditional medicine, chicory has been used to treat a variety of ailments, including digestive issues, skin problems, and fever. Chicory root is rich in the fiber inulin which many people believe is what gives it anti-inflammatory properties and may be beneficial for the liver. Studies have suggested that drinking chicory root tea may improve digestion and reduce inflammation in the gut. Combines well with Roasted Dandelion Root.
\n
\nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.
\n

Short description: Lady's Mantle, Organic, 1oz. bag \nAlchemilla vulgaris \n \nLady's mantle (Alchemilla vulgaris) is an astringent herb that has been used to treat a variety of women's ailments, including menstrual cramps, heavy bleeding, and other women's health issues. It has astringent and anti-inflammatory properties that make it beneficial for skin health. Some studies have suggested that lady's mantle may help to reduce the symptoms of menopause and may also have a positive effect on bone health. Name: Cacao Nibs, Roasted, Organic, 1oz.
Short description:
Cacao Nibs, Roasted, Organic, 1oz. bag
\n
\nIn Mesoamerican cultures, particularly the Aztecs and Maya, Cacao (or cocoa) was highly valued and considered to be "the food of the gods". It was believed that the gods had created cacao and given it to the people as a gift. The word "cacao" derives from "kakawa" which means "food of the gods." Cacao was used in a variety of ways, including being consumed as a bitter beverage, used as a form of currency, and even used in religious ceremonies. The Aztecs believed that consuming cacao would bring one closer to the gods, and it was often used in religious rituals and offerings to the gods.
\n
\nCacao was also believed to have medicinal properties and was used to treat a variety of ailments, including fatigue and fever. It was also believed to have aphrodisiac qualities and was used to improve overall vitality. The ancient Mesoamericans consumed Cacao as a bitter beverage, made from ground cocoa beans, mixed with water and spices, such as chili pepper, vanilla, and honey.
\n
\nAs a medicinal herb, Cacao is a source of stimulating alkaloids such as theobromine and theophylline. This makes Cacao stimulating in a way similar to caffeinated plants. It increases energy and reduces fatigue, while supporting cognitive function.
\n
\nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Dong Quai Root, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Dong Quai Root, Organic, 1oz. bag \nAngelica sinensis \n \nDong Quai, or Dang Gui, is a plant native to China, Japan, and Korea. It has been used in Classical Chinese Medicine for thousands of years as a blood tonic and to regulate menses. It is an ideal blood builder for people who are anemic or have low energy. It has a sweet, moistening, warming, and aromatic quality. The root of the plant is used to make tea, tincture, or capsules. Many formulas will incorporate Dong Quai to help alleviate symptoms of menopause, such as hot flashes, and to treat PMS, infertility, and other women's ailments. It is one of the chief herbs in our Women's Daily Tonic. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Grapefruit Peel, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Grapefruit Peel \nCitrus x paradisi \n \nThe Grapefruit is a citrus fruit of recent origin with uncertain lineage. Its fruit is a composite of sour, bitter, and sweet flavors, with a shape resembling a hybrid between an orange and a pomelo. Dried grapefruit peel provides distinct citrus notes in various applications including culinary and personal care products. Its origins can be traced back to the West Indies in the 1690s, brought by Captain Shaddock from Polynesia. Grapefruit is rich in nutrients including vitamin C, fiber, potassium, iron, and calcium. However, grapefruit can interact with certain medications, including statins, blood pressure medications, and immunosuppressants, among others. Therefore, it is recommended to consult with a healthcare professional before including grapefruit in your diet, particularly if you are taking any medications. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.

Name: Horseradish, Wildcrafted, 1oz. bag
Short description: Horseradish Roots, Wildcrafted, 1oz. bag \nArmoracia rusticana \n \nHorseradish, a member of the mustard family, is famous for its spicy and sharp flavor. It's commonly used as a condiment and served with meat dishes, stews, and roasted vegetables. With roots dating back hundreds of years, horseradish has a rich history of being utilized in traditional European herbal practices. Our horseradish powder is made from Armoracia rusticana roots and can be added to herbal vinegars, sauces, honeys, and condiments. \n \nFreshly grated horseradish is a potent source of mustard oil. The root itself has little to no scent, but when grated, the broken plant cells release enzymes that create its distinct aroma. It's best to use grated horseradish immediately or preserve it in vinegar to retain its flavor. Over time, exposure to air or heat will reduce its pungency, darken its color, and make it bitter, though its beneficial properties will still remain in dried form. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.

Name: St. John's Wort, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: St. John's Wort \nHypericum perforatum \n \nSt. John's Wort is most commonly known as an herb used to combat depression and nerve pain, however traditionally it is also known as an herb for the liver. In fact, it achieves its antidepressant action via increasing various enzymes in the liver. This is important to know because it can increase the metabolism of certain pharmaceuticals and thus is contraindicated with a variety of drugs, especially SSRIs and MAOIs, but also birth control and other drugs. It is indeed a powerful nervine but is also antiviral, anti-inflammatory, astringent, antibacterial, vulnerary, sedative, hepatoprotective (liver protective), and more. If you are taking any pharmaceutical drugs, be sure to talk to your doctor before introducing St. John's Wort into your diet. If you are not taking pharmaceutical drugs then St. John's Wort is a safe and reliable herbal supplement. We also offer St. John's Wort capsules. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

It is indeed a powerful nervine but is also antiviral, anti-inflammatory, astringent, antibacterial, vulnerary, sedative, hepatoprotective (liver protective), and more. If you are taking any pharmaceutical drugs, be sure to talk to your doctor before introducing St. John's Wort into your diet. If you are not taking pharmaceutical drugs then St. John's Wort is a safe and reliable herbal supplement. We also offer St. John's Wort capsules. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: Wild Lettuce, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Wild Lettuce, Organic, 1oz. bag \nLactuca virosa \n \nWild Lettuce is also known as "Lettuce Opium" because of the latex that exudes from the cut stems and leaves. This sticky white latex is incredibly bitter (meaning it is beneficial for digestion, among other things) but it is also a good nervine. It is considered anodyne or analgesic, a good pain relieving herb. Don't worry though, this plant is incredibly safe, even for children. It can help calm a spasmodic cough and allow you to get much needed sleep. You can prepare a strong infusion of the leaves or if you are feeling more adventurous you can harvest some from the wild and collect the sticky white latex, allow it to dry and then smoke it like the old days. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: White Willow Bark, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: White Willow Bark, Organic, 1oz. bag \nSalix alba \n \nWhite Willow Bark is commonly thought of as Nature's Aspirin or the original plant in which aspirin (salicylic acid) was found. While it is true that Willow Bark is a source of salicylic acid, the original aspirin plant was actually Meadowsweet. Regardless, White Willow Bark has secured its place as nature's aspirin and indeed it is a good natural anti-inflammatory herb. Willow Bark is a source of salicin and salicyl glycosides. It is specific for sores of the mucosa, such as ulcers, fever with intermittent chills, rheumatism, menstrual irritation and tiredness. Other uses include headache, pain, general inflammation. We also offer White Willow Bark Tincture. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Wild Cherry Bark, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Wild Cherry Bark, Organic, 1oz. bag \nPrunus serotina \n \nWild Cherry Bark is a classic antitussive herb that makes its way into numerous cough syrups and herbal tea blends. According to Michael Tierra: "Wild Cherry Bark calms the respiratory nerves, allays coughs and asthma. It is also excellent for digestive weakness including ulcers, gastritis, colitis, diarrhea and dysentary". (pp. 206 The Way of Herbs) He also tells us that this particular herb is best prepared with a cool water overnight infusion and then warmed up slightly. Exposure to high heat reduces the cough relieving properties. Also try our Wild Cherry Bark tincture. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only.

Description:
Simplicity at its finest! This product is contains only two ingredients: the highest quality Vermont Grown full spectrum CBD extract and organic coconut oil.
\n
\nEat a teaspoonful of the oil or rub it on as a salve for aches and pains.
\n
\nPlease be aware this coconut oil will liquify above 74 degrees.
\nKeep in a cool, dry, dark place.
\n
\nAs a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It is important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider.

Name: Metabolism Boost
Short description: Metabolism Boost, 9oz. \n \nContains: Jiaogulan, Grapefruit Peel, Lemon Peel, Gymnema, Ginger, Cinnamon, Hibiscus, Yerba Mate, Kola nut \nAll Organic or Wildcrafted \n \nThis formula is designed to support a health weight loss program, but it is also important to change your diet and get more exercise. The Jiaogulan and Citrus Peels promotes youthful levels and activity of the AMPK enzyme. AMPK tells your cells to stop storing fat and start burning it for energy, especially around the abdomen. In addition, the Gymnema supports healthy blood sugar levels which are interrelated with metabolism. Ginger and Cinnamon and warming circulatory stimulants that also have numerous benefits on metabolism and blood sugar. Hibiscus is a source of hydroxycitric acid which may help to suppress appetite and induce weight loss. Yerba Mate and Kola nut are sources of caffeine and other stimulating alkaloids and thus help to reduce appetite and increase energy levels through the day. Drink 1 - 2 cups in the morning. \n \nThis product has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: Ashwagandha Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Ashwagandha Tincture 2oz. \nWithania somnifera \n \n \nAshwagandha is a “Rasayana” or rejevunating adaptogenic herb which has been used in Ayurveda for centuries. This herb is ideal for those who are low energy, dealing with poor sleep or fatigue. Note the latin “somnifera” is akin to “insomnia” which indicates it is useful for sleep problems. Take 1ml in a little water, juice or tea, up to 3 times per day. We also offer Ashwagandha in bulk for making tea. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: California Poppy Tincture 2oz.
Short description: California Poppy Tincture 2oz.  \nEschsolzia californica \n \nCalifornia Poppy is one of the gentlest nervines, safe and effective for both children and adults. Although California Poppy is not nearly as powerful as Opium Poppy, it still possesses a range of alkaloids that may be helpful with pain, inflammation, and sleeplessness. It is one of the most important herbs in our Hemp Nervine formula. Try it in bulk as a tea or in combination with your favorite nervine herbs. \n \nOrganically Grown Dried Aerial Portion \nExtracted in 50% Organic Cane Alcohol and Reverse Osmosis Maple Water \nHerb Strength Ratio: 1 : 3 \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Licorice Root Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Licorice Root Tincture 2oz.  \n \n \nLicorice is an amazing adaptogenic herb as well as a harmonizer in Traditional Chinese Medicine. Added to formulas it can bring synergy to the formula or aid in absorption. It also offers a powerful anti-inflammatory action as well as a soothing effect on the gastrointestinal system. Do not take licorice if you have high blood pressure. Take 30 drops in water or juice, 1 – 3 times daily, or as needed. We also offer Licorice Root in bulk for making tea. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Comfrey Root Liniment 2oz.
Short description: Comfrey Root Liniment 2oz. \nSymphytum officinale \n \nComfrey gets a bad name for a particular constituent known as Pyrrolizidine alkaloids (PAs), but this constituent is found in other plants as well and is really only harmful in super high doses. These alkaloids are more potent in the roots, but are also present in Comfrey Leaf. While some studies have suggested that the PAs in comfrey may be harmful, others have found that the herb is safe when used in small amounts and for short periods of time. While it is recommended that Comfrey only be used topically, this is a matter of great debate among herbalists. The dried herb can be used in poultices for sore muscles, broken bones, stiff joints, and other musculoskeletal complaints. We also carry Comfrey Root in bulk. \n \nWe plant Comfrey in our herb garden around the edges of the porch and building. It is a wonderful plant in permaculture as it helps to pull up minerals from the soil and then the leaves can be used as a “green manure”. They provide a beautiful ground cover as well as nourishment for the pollinators. However, be aware that certain types of Comfrey are fast spreading and could take over your garden if you let it. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Wild Rose Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Wild Rose Tincture 2oz. \nRosa canina \n \nEvery summer we gather wild roses for our Rosewater Distillation Workshop. This past year we had enough rosebuds to tincture fresh, but I wanted it to be something special, so I used the water from the distillation process (basically a rose tea) with the organic cane alcohol. Not only that but we added the residual rose oil from the distillation process, along with some more dried roses and a bit of organic glycerin. Needless to say, this Wild Rose Tincture is truly phenomenal! Powerfully floral aromatic notes come together for an extract that calms the heart and mind. We also offer Rose Absolute in Jojoba oil for massage. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Valerian Root Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Valerian Root Tincture, 2oz. \nValeriana officinalis \n \nOrganically Grown Fresh & Dried Roots \nExtracted in 60% Organic Cane Alcohol and Reverse Osmosis Maple Water \nHerb Strength Ratio: 1 : 2 \n \nValerian is a warming, aromatic, sweet and  spicy root that is most recognized for its calming effect. It is used for restlessness, hysteria, emotional stress, pain, insomnia, depression, anxiety, nervous palpitations, and more. Despite the common myth, Valerian is in no way related to the benzodiazepine drug Valium. Valerian is incredibly safe. We also offer Valerian capsules. \n \nTake 30 drops in water or juice, 1 – 3 times daily, or as needed. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Propolis Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Propolis Tincture 2oz. \nResina propoli \n \nLocally Collected Propolis from Vermont Beekeepers \nExtracted in 95% Organic Cane Alcohol \nHerb Strength Ratio 1 : 3 \n \nPropolis is the tree resin that bees use to coat their hives. The word literally means “for the health of the city” and indeed it does keep the beehive clean and protected from bacteria and viruses. It is a very strong antimicrobial. It can be used topically on cuts and wounds. It is indicated for bronchitis, pneumonia, and other respiratory infections. Take 30 drops in water or juice, 1 – 3 times daily, or as directed by a healthcare professional. \n \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Heart & Vascular (Fire Element) Workshop
Short description:
Heart & Vascular (Fire Element) Workshop \n \nJoin us on Saturday, June 10th from 10AM – 1PM for the second class in our Five Element Workshop Series. \n \nHeart & Vascular (Fire Element) \nFor this class we will meet at the herb shop and then drive a short distance where we will harvest wild roses which we will bring back to the herb shop where we will proceed to distill them into rosewater. While we wait for the rosewater to distill, we will discuss: \n
    \n
  • Physiology of the Cardiovascular System
    • \n
  • Herbs that support the heart and blood vessels
    • \n
  • The connection between the heart and the nervous system
    • \n
  • Medicinal foods that support the cardiovascular system
    • \n
  • How to create rosewater and the benefits of roses on the heart
    • \n
\nPlease bring a basket or bucket to help gather roses. You may want to wear gloves, long sleeves, and long pants if you plan to go into the bushes! However, keep in mind it is likely the weather will be warm.

Description:
Our Bio-Quercetin supplement uses a quercetin encased in a plant-derived phytosome, which makes absorption easier. Our quercetin is up to 50 times more bioavailable than a dose of standard quercetin.
\n
\nQuercetin is right up there with vitamin C as one of the most powerful nutrients for immune health, and it benefits your heart, too. But like many phytonutrients, quercetin isn’t easy to absorb. So we wrapped it up in a phytosome, a plant-based, phospholipid sphere that makes this formula up to 50 times more available than conventional quercetin.

Name: St. John's Wort Tincture 2oz.
Short description: St. John's Wort Tincture 2oz. \nHypericum perforatum \n \n \nSt. John’s Wort is most commonly known as an herb used to combat depression and nerve pain, however traditionally it is also known as an herb for the liver. In fact, it achieves its antidepressant action via increasing various enzymes in the liver. This is important to know because it can increase the metabolism of certain pharmaceuticals and thus is contraindicated with a variety of drugs, especially SSRIs and MAOIs, but also birth control and other drugs. It is indeed a powerful nervine but is also antiviral, anti-inflammatory, astringent, antibacterial, vulnerary, sedative, hepatoprotective (liver protective), and more. If you are taking any pharmaceutical drugs, be sure to talk to your doctor before introducing St. John’s Wort into your diet. If you are not taking pharmaceutical drugs then St. John’s Wort is a safe and reliable herbal supplement. We also offer St. John’s Wort capsules. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: Cool n' Calm Herbal Honey 6oz.
Short description:
Cool n' Calm Herbal Honey 6oz.
\n
\nIngredients: Raw Honey, Lemon Balm (Melissa officinalis), Catnip (Nepeta cataria), Chamomile (Matricaria recutita), Lavender (Lavandula officinalis), St. John’s Wort (Hypericum perforatum), Skullcap (Scutellaria laterifloria), Vanilla (Vanilla planifolia)
\n
\nThis supportive formula is restorative and calming to the nervous system with a special affinity to children. Calming to the digestive and nervous systems, Cool n’ Calm is a great ally for parents in preparation for nap or bedtime or when a child is needing a little extra stress support that can also affect the digestive system. Great support for aiding in longer term bed-wetting due to nervous system disturbance too. With organic vanilla powder, this is a favorite of most kids.

\n
\nIngredients: Raw Honey, Gynostema (Gynostemma pentaphyllum), Siberian Ginseng (Eleutherococcus senticosus), Schisandra (Schisandra chinensis), Nettle (Urtica dioica), Licorice (Glycyrrhiza glabra)
\n
\nIn an increasingly stressful world, adaptogenic botanicals can provide us with tremendous support; increasing resilience and mitigating the negative effects of stress, especially as it impacts the immune, endocrine and nervous systems. It is advised that adaptogens not be used in place of sleep or a healthy, balanced lifestyle.

Name: Reishi Mushroom Dual Extract Powder 16:1
Short description: Reishi Mushroom Dual Extract Powder 16:1 \n \nScientific research into the compounds responsible for Reishi mushroom activity began in the 1970’s in China and Japan. Scientists discovered highly active beta-(1-3)(1-6)-glucans with the ability to potentiate innate immunity by activating immune cells. Also discovered were secondary metabolites called triterpenoids which were present in significant amounts and sets Reishi apart from all the other medicinal mushrooms. We also offer Vermont Reishi Tincture that is very popular. \n \nStore in a cool, dry, place out of direct sunlight. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: Mushroom Complex Dual Extract Powder 3oz.
Short description: Mushroom Complex Dual Extract Powder 3oz. \n \nThis dynamic mushroom blend is a combination of 5 of the most powerful fruiting body extracts. The blend consists of Chaga, Maitake, Shiitake, Reishi, and Turkey Tail. The Chaga and Reishi are an alcohol/water extraction at 90° and spray dried. Name: CBD Stress Adapt capsules
Short description:
CBD Stress Adapt
\nCBD+Herbal Blend
\n30mg CBD per serving (900mg CBD per bottle)
\n
\nThis potent botanical formula contains 30mg CBD (242mg broad and full spectrum hemp extract) and a proprietary blend of herbs comprised of Ashwagandha Root, Holy Basil, Cordyceps Mycelia, Schisandra Berry, and Rhodiola Root. Other ingredients: Organic sunflower lecithin, vegetable cellulose, organic MCT oil (from coconut). Take 1 capsules once per day.
\n
\nUSA Grown Hemp, Vegan, Gluten Free, Non-GMO, Contains less than 0.3% THC
\n
\nAs a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It is important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider.

\nAs a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It is important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider.

Name: Fertility-Preg 1oz.
Short description:
Fertility-Preg 1oz.
\nAlcohol Free
\n
\nThis alcohol free herbal blend combines Red Raspberry Leaf, Red Clover Blossoms, Nettles Leaf, and Yellow Dock Root. Fertility-Pregnancy is a tonic formula that women can use when trying to get pregnant or are already pregnant. It is also a tonic for miscarriages. These herbs are considered nutritive, i.e. they provide vitamins and minerals. Yellow Dock helps facilitate iron absorption in the small intestine to avoid or overcome pregnant anemia. Take 30 drops in juice or water, 1 - 3 times daily, or as directed by your healthcare professional.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

\nThis Black Cumin Seed oil is certified organic and is of the utmost quality. Also known as Nigella or Black Seed, this oil is a rich source of the phytochemical thymoquinone. Name: Andrographis Capsules 90ct
Short description: Andrographis 90 Veggie Caps \n \nAndrographis is a powerful bitter that may be used to stimulate immune function and support a healthy inflammation response. The incredible bitterness of this plant means it may have a blood sugar lowering effect. It should only be used in smaller doses; large doses may cause griping (gastrointestinal pain & constipation). However, do not let this deter you as this plant has remarkable properties in combatting various bacteria, viruses, fungi, etc. Each capsules contains approximately 400mg Andrographis paniculata. In addition to this, Andrographis is part of the Stephen Buhner Lyme Protocol. Consider taking it alongside our Cat’s Claw tincture for added immune support. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Eidon Multiple Mineral 2oz.
Short description:
Eidon Multi Mineral 2oz.
\n
\nEidon's multiple minerals are a complement of all essential and trace minerals necessary for good health in a silica base. In any multiple mineral formulae, the key to its successful formulation lies in its mineral balance. Minerals work in a precise balance or ratio to one another. Too much or too little of even a trace mineral can decrease the effectiveness of a formula by limiting the availability of the other minerals. For people with well-balanced mineral ratios or those looking for a basic formula to supply a well-balanced broad spectrum of the most important mineral nutrients, Eidon's multiple mineral formulae can be an excellent addition to your nutritional program. Eidon's formulation reflects the most current understanding of optimal balance in a mineral formula. The macro minerals, calcium, and magnesium are kept in a 1:1 ratio to correct the erroneous dietary trend of high calcium and low magnesium intake. Easy on the stomach. Safe for all ages no color or scent.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Fire Cider 8oz.
Short description: Ignite your seasonal shield with our Fire Cider, a bold, organic herbal elixir designed to fortify both your immune and digestive resilience. Crafted in small batches, this warming tonic blends traditional wisdom with potent botanicals to support cold & flu prevention, sinus clarity, and digestive balance.
Description:
Fire Cider 8 oz – Spicy Immune & Digestive Booster

\n

Ignite your seasonal shield with our Fire Cider, a bold, organic herbal elixir designed to fortify both your immune and digestive resilience. Crafted in small batches, this warming tonic blends traditional wisdom with potent botanicals to support cold & flu prevention, sinus clarity, and digestive balance.

\n

Ingredients & Benefits:
We simmer raw apple cider vinegar (with “the mother”) with garlic, onions, ginger, horseradish, hot wax peppers, habanero, cayenne, lime, turmeric, rosemary, and Vermont honey—creating a powerhouse formula rich in immunomodulators, antimicrobial compounds, and circulatory stimulants.

\n

How to Use:

\n \n
    \n
  • \n

    Start with a ½ to 1 teaspoon daily to boost your immune defenses and enhance digestive comfort.

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    Increase to 1 full tablespoon during seasonal shifts, cold & flu exposure, or when you need sinus and respiratory support.

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    Enjoy as a swift shot, mix into warm water or tea, or add a kick to sauces and dressings.

    \n
    • \n
\n

Safety & Usage Notes:
Extremely spicy—may aggravate ulcers, acid reflux, or digestive irritation. Contains honey—not for infants under 1 year. Use with caution if you’re on blood pressure or blood-thinning medications (e.g., garlic or turmeric effects). Not suitable during pregnancy without consultation. Avoid if sensitive to heat or with known gastric conditions.

\n \n
\n

These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. Not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Please consult your healthcare provider before use.

\n

Name: Alaska Rhodiola Tincture 2oz.
Short description:
Alaska Rhodiola Tincture (2 oz)
Cultivated in the wilds of Alaska for peak potency, our Rhodiola rosea tincture is a powerful adaptogenic tonic crafted to enhance your energy, focus, and stress resilience.

\n \n
    \n
  • \n

    Proven Benefits: Traditionally used in Siberia, Scandinavia, and Tibet, Rhodiola rosea helps the body adapt to stress, sharpen cognitive function, support endurance, and protect against mild respiratory challenges.

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    Sourced for Quality: Grown in Alaska using best agricultural practices, this tincture ensures you get wild-quality potency in every drop—supporting both local farmers and optimal herb integrity.

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    How to Use: Take 30 drops (about 1 ml) in water or juice, 1–3 times daily as needed. Ideal before demanding mental or physical activity—not recommended near bedtime due to its stimulating adaptogenic action.

    \n
    • \n
\n

Safety & Usage Notes
Rhodiola may elevate heart rate or blood pressure—use with caution if you take hypertension medications. Because of its energizing effects, avoid use before sleep. Not advised during pregnancy or for those with bipolar disorder unless under medical supervision. Not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Name: Nettle tincture 2 oz
Short description: Nettle tincture, 2 oz. Urtica dioica \n \nStinging Nettles is considered to be alterative (blood cleansing), diuretic, nutritive, and all around amazing mineral rich herb with numerous beneficial properties. Many people use it for seasonal allergies and respiratory support as well. The stinging nettles used in this tincture were locally grown right here in Morrisville, Vermont. We harvest at the peak of its potency and then process it fresh with organic cane alcohol and reverse osmosis maple water. \n \nWe also offer Stinging Nettles in bulk. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Berberine 60 Capsules
Short description: Berberine 60 Capsules \n \nSource Naturals Berberine provides 500 mg of berberine hydrochloride, an amount shown in clinical studies to support multiple body systems. A human clinical trial has shown that berberine supplementation can support gastrointestinal health. Several clinical trials suggest that berberine can help support healthy blood glucose levels and healthy blood cholesterol levels already within the normal range. \n \nSupplement Facts: \nServing Size 1 vegetarian capsule \n \nAmount Per Serving: \nBerberine HCI (from Berberis aristata root) 500mg \nOther ingredients: hydroxypropyl, methylcellulose (capsule), maltodextrin, stearic acid, and magnesium stearate. \n \nSuggested Use: One (1) capsule 1 to 2 times daily with meals, or as recommended by a healthcare practitioner. \n \nAllergies: Suitable for vegans and vegetarians. Contains no yeast, dairy, egg, gluten, soy or wheat. Contains no preservatives, or artificial color, flavor or fragrance. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Lemon Balm Tincture 2oz
Short description: Lemon Balm Tincture 2oz. \n \nThis lemon balm (Melissa officinalis) tincture is made in house from fresh aerial parts of Vermont Garden Grown Lemon Balm. The herb is considered sour, spicy, and cool. The properties of Lemon Balm are diaphoretic, calmative, antispasmodic, carminative, emmenagogue, and stomachic. It is also know for having antiviral properties, being used in topical preparations for Herpes simplex virus. It is the perfect remedy to help break a fever, an ideal children’s remedy, for stomach problems as well as calming the nerves and helping fall asleep. Take 30 drops (1 ml) in water or juice, 1 – 3 times daily, or as needed. \n \nExtracted in 47.5% Organic Cane Alcohol & Organic Vegetable Glycerin. 1:4 Herb Strength Ratio. \n \nVermont Garden Grown Lemon Balm \n \nWe also sell Lemon Balm in bulk form \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Eidon Magnesium Liquid Concentrate 2oz
Short description: Eidon Magnesium Liquid Concentrate 2oz \n \nMagnesium plays an essential role in over 300 enzyme reactions in the human body. All refined foods are lacking Ionic Magnesium, as well as most other essential minerals. Many Americans eat a highly refined diet and are, as a result, deficient in Magnesium. Magnesium makes muscles relax. This is very important for heart function as the body needs ample stores of Ionic Magnesium to allow for proper heart muscle relaxation. Some important functions of Magnesium are: regulates calcium transport and deposition into bone, necessary for tissue growth and development, supports immune system health and function, a primary electrolyte along with Calcium, Potassium, Sodium and Chloride, helps in the conduction of nerve impulses and the relaxation of muscle tissue. \n \nSupplement Facts: Magnesium (as magnesium chloride) 80 mg (20% DV) \n \nOther ingredients: de-ionized water \n \nSuggested use: 30 drops (2 dropper squeezes) per day in water. Children under five - 15 drops. \n \nEidon Liquid Minerals are All Natural, Highly Bioavailable and contain NO sugars, starch, artificial flavors, colors, preservatives or animal by-products. Vegan and Gluten-Free. \n \nWe also carry Neuro-Mag Magnesium L-Threonate capsules as well as Neuro-Mag Magnesium L-Threonate Tropical Punch Powder. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.
