Name: Eidon Zinc Liquid Concentrate 2 oz
Short description:
Eidon Zinc Liquid Concentrate 2 oz \n

Eidon's Ionic Liquid Zinc is essential for the maintenance of immune system strength and glandular health. It can be rapidly depleted when the body is fighting an illness. Zinc is the tenth most abundant element in the human body. Zinc liquid is found in all organs, tissues and cells, and is involved in the function and activation of many cellular enzymes. Enzymes are the unique cellular protein compounds that make the human body function properly.

\nZinc promotes immune system health by activating the production of white blood cells. Zinc also activates the production of numerous compounds necessary for growth and development. Like enzymes, they are proteins essential to the body's health and function. These proteins are produced in specific organs in the body, passed into the bloodstream and carried to distant cells and organs to stimulate the functioning of that organ. \n

Zinc liquid supplement helps to support a healthy endocrine system, including the pituitary, thyroid, parathyroids, adrenals, pineal, pancreas and reproductive glands.

\nExcessive exposure to heavy metals (arsenic, cadmium and lead), alcohol, tobacco, pesticides, herbicides and fungicides, deplete the body’s zinc stores. Zinc deficiencies may also result from excess stress. \n \nSupplement Facts: Zinc (as zinc sulfate) 7.5 mg (50% DV). Other ingredients: De-ionized water \n \nServing Size 30 drops (2ml) \n \nSuggested Use: 30 drops (2 dropper squeezes) per day in water. Children under five - 15 drops. \n \nEidon Liquid Minerals are All Natural, Highly Bioavailable and contain NO sugars, starch, artificial flavors, colors, preservatives or animal by-products. Vegan and Gluten-Free. \n \nWe also carry Zinc Caps, 50 mg. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Eidon Potassium Liquid Concentrate 2 oz
Short description: Eidon Potassium Liquid Concentrate 2 oz \n \nPotassium is one of seven inorganic, macro mineral nutrients needed in relatively high daily amounts. It is the third most prevalent element in the body after Calcium. Along with Chloride, Sodium, Magnesium and Calcium, Potassium is an essential electrolyte. These elements are called electrolytes because they carry an electrical charge when dissolved in body fluids. Electrolytes help regulate nerve transmission and many cell membrane functions. Magnesium helps maintain the Potassium in the cells; but even more crucial is the proper Sodium to Potassium balance. Without Potassium, cell function will be impacted. Potassium works with Sodium to regulate blood pressure, transmit nerve impulses, and maintain cellular wall permeability. Along with Magnesium, it is essential for the proper functioning of the heart muscle. In this role, Potassium acts as the catalyst stimulating cellular contraction. Potassium has many functions but most important are: regulating intracellular fluids, aids in the regulation of the body's water balance, facilitating nerve impulses, transmission of electrical signals between nerves and cells, contracting muscle tissue, balancing the acid/alkaline system. \n \nSupplement Facts: Potassium (as potassium chloride) 99mg (3% DV). Other ingredients: de-ionized water. \n \nServing Size: 30 drops (2ml) \n \nSuggested use: 30 drops (2 dropper squeezes) per day in water. Children under five - 15 drops. \n \nEidon Liquid Minerals are All Natural, Highly Bioavailable and contain NO sugars, starch, artificial flavors, colors, preservatives or animal by-products. Vegan and Gluten-Free. \n \nYou may also be interested in: Potassium with Extend-Release Magnesium.  \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.
Description: Eidon Potassium Liquid Concentrate 2 oz \n \nPotassium, an essential electrolyte, regulates nerve transmission, maintains cellular function, and aids heart health. Name: Super K 90 softgels
Short description:
Super K 90 softgels \n \nSuper K combines vitamin K1 with two forms of vitamin K2 in a once-daily vitamin K supplement to help support bone & heart health. Super K provides three different kinds of vitamin K. Vitamin K1, the optimal bone health and arterial health. The forms of K2 found in this supplement are MK-7 and MK-4, commonly found in some types of dairy. Vitamin K2 has been found to be up to 6 times more bioavailable than K1 and to remain active in the body for a longer period of time. A recent trial has demonstrated that nighttime leg cramps were reduced with Vitamin K2. \n

Supplement Facts: \nVitamin C (as Ascorbyl palmitate) 10 mg \nVitamin K activity 2600 mcg

\nFrom: \nVitamin K1 (as phytonadione) 1500 mcg \nVitamin K2 (as menaquinone-4) 1000 mcg \nVitamin K2 (as trans menaquione-7) 100 mcg \n

These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. \nThese products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.
Description:
Super K – 90 Softgels
Your once-daily solution for optimal vitamin K support—promoting strong bones, healthy arteries, and balanced calcium metabolism.

\n

Product Highlights:

\n \n
    \n
  • \n

    Triple-form vitamin K blend: Provides K1 and both bioactive K2 forms (MK-4 & MK-7) for superior absorption and extended support.

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    Supports bone density & arterial health: Vitamin K facilitates calcium integration into bones while keeping calcium from depositing in arteries—helping maintain robust skeletal structure and healthy circulation.

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    Convenient daily dosing: One softgel per day delivers 1500 mcg K1, 1000 mcg K2 (MK-4), and 100 mcg K2 (MK-7), making it easy to meet your daily vitamin K needs.

    \n
    • \n
  • \n

    High-quality formulation: Gluten-free, non-GMO, and carefully crafted for purity and potency.

    \n
    • \n
\n

Suggested Use:
Take one (1) softgel daily with a meal or as recommended by your healthcare professional.

\n

Important Safety Information:
If you are taking anticoagulant medications (e.g., warfarin), consult your healthcare provider before use. Not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. If pregnant or nursing, talk to your physician before taking this or any supplement.

Name: Tea Infuser - Mesh Ball
Short description: Mesh Tea Ball, 2.5" Diameter \n \nEnjoy the perfect cup of tea with this stainless steel mesh tea ball - an easy way to brew an individual cup of tea or small pot from loose tea leaves. Features a chain with hook and a strong-locking clasp - perfect for tea leaves, and also great for herbs and spices.  You can use the hook to hang it onto the edge of your cup. \n \nSee our selection of loose leaf bulk herbs, as well as our made-in-house tea blends, such as our Calming Nervine Formula. \n \nYou may also be interested in our Tea - Infuser with with spring action handles, or our Tea Infuser - Over the Cup Basket Style.

Name: Tea Infuser with Spring Action Handle
Short description: Mesh Tea Ball with Spring Action Handle. 2.25" D Mesh Ball. \n \nEnjoy the perfect cup of tea with this stainless steel mesh tea ball with spring action handle - an easy way to brew an individual cup of tea or small pot from loose tea leaves. Works with most loose leaf tea leaves, and is also great for herbs and spices. The long spring action handle provides easy retrieval- just squeeze the handle and the infuser slides open. Long, stainless steel neck accommodates most cups and mugs. \n \nYou may also be interested in our Tea Infuser - Mesh Ball. \n \nA tea infuser would make a great gift, along with an herbal tea blend such as our Snooze Blend, as well as a jar of herbal honey such as the Sleepezz Herbal Honey.

Name: Tea Infuser - Basket Style
Short description: Tea Infuser - Basket Style. This tea infuser fits right over the top of your favorite tea mug or jar and is the perfect way to brew loose leaf tea. It is stainless steel and does not alter the taste of the tea. The fine mesh infuser is large enough for the leaves to fully open and the water to flow freely though them, essential in order to take full advantage of high quality teas. Suitable for cups and glasses between 6.5 and 10 cm in diameter. Practical and easy to clean. This basket infuser even comes with a lid to keep the volatile oils from evaporating while your tea brews - keep all the medicine down in your cup of tea! \n \nYou may also be interested in our Tea Infuser – Mesh Ball, or our Tea Infuser with Spring Action Handle. \n \nA tea infuser would make a great gift, along with an herbal tea blend such as our Snooze Blend, as well as a jar of herbal honey such as the Sleepezz Herbal Honey.

Name: Astragalus Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Astragalus Tincture 2oz. \n \nAstragalus (Astragalus membranaceous) is one of the premier immune tonics from Traditional Chinese Medicine. It is better to take this herb as a builder when you are well and not during the acute phase of infection. Also consider Astragalus root in bulk. \n \nThis Astragalus Tincture is part of our Artisan Collection of tinctures and products that we make on site, and is made from Organically Grown Dried Roots. Dual Extracted in 40-50% Organic Cane Alcohol & Reverse Osmosis Maple Water. \n \nHerb Strength Ratio: 1:2.5 \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Ginger Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Ginger Tincture 2oz. \n \nGinger (Zingiber officinale) is one of the most important herbs in the entire materia medica. This warming, spicy, pungent root has a pronounced effect on the circulatory system as well as digestion. Many people think only of ginger to help settle the stomach (which it does amazingly) but it is also one of the best herbs to help support a healthy inflammatory response. Also the perfect herb to add to formulas as it helps move the formula and aid in absorption. Take 30 drops in juice or water, 1 – 3 times daily, or as needed. If it is too spicy then take with a meal. \n \nThis Ginger Tincture is part of our Artisan Collection of tinctures and products that we make on site in Morrisville, Vermont, and is made from Organically Grown Dried Roots. Extracted in 60% Organic Cane Alcohol & Reverse Osmosis Maple Water. Herb Strength Ratio: 1:1.7. Take 30 drops in water or juice, 1 – 3 times daily, or as needed. \n \nYou may also be interested in CBD InflaSoother Capsules which contain ginger. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Goldenrod Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Goldenrod Tincture 2oz. \n \nGoldenrod (Solidago canadensis) is knows for its wonderfully aromatic properties and is also drying, carminative, diuretic, astringent, and anti-inflammatory. Some of the traditional uses include seasonal allergies, bladder support, and diarrhea. \n \nThis Goldenrod Tincture is part of our Artisan Collection of tinctures and products that we make on site in Morrisville, Vermont, and is made from Locally Wildcrafted Fresh Aerial Parts. Extracted in 55% Organic Cane Alcohol & Reverse Osmosis Maple Water. Herb Strength Ratio: 1:2. Take 30 drops in water or juice, 1 – 3 times daily, or as needed. \n \nYou may also be interested in our Stinging Nettle Tincture, which has a few overlapping properties and uses including seasonal allergy and respiratory support. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Horseradish Tincture 2oz
Short description: Horseradish Tincture 2oz. \n \nHorseradish, (Armoracia rusticana) a member of the mustard family, is famous for its spicy and sharp flavor. It’s commonly used as a condiment and served with meat dishes, stews, and roasted vegetables. With roots dating back hundreds of years, horseradish has a rich history of being utilized in traditional European herbal practices. Some of its useful properties include supporting the respiratory system, digestion, reducing inflammation as well as antimicrobial and antibacterial support. It's also a common ingredient in Fire Cider. \n \nThis information has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. For educational purposes only. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Short description: Olive Leaf Tincture 2oz. \n \nOlive Leaf (Olea europaea) is a remarkable herb that has antiviral, antioxidant, hypotensive, and cardioprotective properties. Name: Raspberry Leaf Tincture 2 oz
Short description: Raspberry Leaf Tincture 2 oz \n \nRaspberry Leaf (Rubus idaeus) is a cooling, astringent, nutritive herb that is rich in many minerals. It is most commonly used as a uterine tonic for pregnant women, being recommended in the second and third trimesters. \n \nThis Raspberry Leaf Tincture is part of our Artisan Collection of tinctures and products that we make on site in Morrisville, Vermont, and is made from Wildcrafted Dried Aerial Parts. Name: Wormwood Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Wormwood Tincture 2oz. \n \nWormwood (Artemisia absinthium) is a strong bitter herb with a great deal of history behind it. It is anthelmintic (meaning it kills parasites), antimicrobial, antiviral, antifungal, the list goes on. Energetically it is cold, bitter and acts upon the liver and gallbladder, making it an ideal herb to aid in digestion. \n \nThis Wormwood Tincture is part of our Artisan Collection of tinctures and products that we make on site in Morrisville, Vermont, and is made from Vermont Garden Grown Fresh Aerial Portions. Extracted in 95% Organic Cane Alcohol. Herb Strength Ratio: 1:5. Take 30 drops in water or juice, 1 – 3 times daily, or as needed. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Teasel Tincture 4oz
Short description: Teasel Tincture 4oz \nDipsacus fullonum \n \nTeasel Root has antibacterial, antiviral, detoxifying, and immune boosting properties.  It has been traditionally used to support a healthy musculoskeletal system (muscles, bones, ligaments, and tendons). It is bitter, aromatic, slightly sweet, clearing, and stimulating. The teasel root offered by Mountain Rose Herbs is responsibly gathered by local wildcrafters. \n \nTeasel is easily recognized by its prickly leaves and stem, along with its pinkish or purplish flowers that form on a large head.  According to the herbalist Brigitte Mars, “the common name teasel derives from the Old English word “tcesan”, meaning “to tease”, in reference to the use of the tops in carding wool. \n \nOur Mountain Rose Herbs teasel tincture is made with fresh teasel roots and organic alcohol at their extract facility. Teasel extract can be blended with Solomon’s seal extract, or turmeric extract, among others. It can be taken in water or juice or added to teas such as turmeric ginger tea. \n \nIngredients \nOrganic alcohol, water, and fresh teasel root. \n \nSupplement Facts: Serving size 1mL. Servings per container: 120. \nAmount per serving: Teasel (root): 0.25g \nOther Ingredients: Organic Alcohol (50-60%) and water. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. Description: Teasel Tincture 4oz \nDipsacus fullonum \n \nTeasel Root has antibacterial, antiviral, detoxifying, and immune boosting properties.  It has been traditionally used to support a healthy musculoskeletal system (muscles, bones, ligaments, and tendons). It is bitter, aromatic, slightly sweet, clearing, and stimulating. The teasel root offered by Mountain Rose Herbs is responsibly gathered by local wildcrafters. \n \nTeasel is easily recognized by its prickly leaves and stem, along with its pinkish or purplish flowers that form on a large head.  According to the herbalist Brigitte Mars, “the common name teasel derives from the Old English word “tcesan”, meaning “to tease”, in reference to the use of the tops in carding wool. \n \nOur Mountain Rose Herbs teasel tincture is made with fresh teasel roots and organic alcohol at their extract facility. Teasel extract can be blended with Solomon’s seal extract, or turmeric extract, among others. It can be taken in water or juice or added to teas such as turmeric ginger tea. \n \nIngredients \nOrganic alcohol, water, and fresh teasel root. \n \nSupplement Facts: Serving size 1mL. Servings per container: 120. \nAmount per serving: Teasel (root): 0.25g \nOther Ingredients: Organic Alcohol (50-60%) and water. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine. \n \n

Name: Mango Seed Butter, 4oz
Short description: Mango Seed Butter, Refined, 4oz \nMangifera indica \n \nMango Seed Butter is pressed from the seed kernel of the mango tree, and this highly prized butter is an exceptional quality base ingredient for body care products and soap making recipes. Mango butter has a composition resembling shea and cocoa, with a slightly different fatty acid content. Mango butter smells slightly sweet and fatty in its natural form, and the refined butter that we offer smells very mild lending itself well to incorporation within cosmetic and body care creations. \n \nIt generally has a rich creamy color and is hard at room temperature. Mango butter has natural emollient properties; it has traditionally been used in the rain forest and tropics for its moisturizing and smoothing properties. It is a great source of essential fatty acids, and has beneficial moisturizing properties for lotions and acts as a mild lubricant for the skin. \n \nTo prolong its shelf life, store in a dark, cool location. Mango is a relatively hard butter and does not apply well as a “stand alone” application; however it will disperse evenly onto the skin once liquefied and warmed. It is best used within cosmetic formulations or added with other ingredients to make it more pliable. \n \nWe package our Refined Mango Seed Butter into 4 oz glass jars for your use. \n \nYou may also be interested in Jojoba Seed Oil.  \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Shea Butter Organic Unrefined 4oz
Short description: Shea Butter Organic Unrefined 4oz \nVitellaria paradoxa \n \nThis organic unrefined shea butter is crafted from shea nuts grown in Ghana. Shea butter is popular in the natural body care and cosmetic industry and has been used for centuries in Africa for its moisturizing properties. \n \nShea butter contains vitamins A and E as well as essential fatty acids and other vitamins and minerals. Shea butter is an intense moisturizer for rough skin. Due to its emollient properties, it is a perfect ingredient to include in your body care recipes and skin care regime. It is also wonderful to use in the summer as a moisturizer before and after sun exposure. \n \nBecause of its unrefined state, the scent of this butter is quite odoriferous and may alter your product’s aroma. The aroma of our Shea butter is often described as thick and nutty. There are often slight differences in the color from batch to batch likely due to natural variance. To prolong its shelf life, store in a cool, dark location. \n \nWe package this Organic Unrefined Shea Butter into 4 oz glass jars for your use. \n \nYou may also be interested in Mango Seed Butter or our local Vermont Beeswax. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Motherwort herb, Vermont Grown Organic, 1 oz bag
Short description: Motherwort herb \nLeonorus cardiaca \n \nOrganically grown by Foster Farm Botanicals in East Calais, Vermont. \n \nMotherwort is ideal for those experiencing anxiety, cardiovascular palpitations, delayed menses, poor sleep, nervousness, grief, or a broken heart. It is bitter, spicy, and cooling. It is considered to be emmenagogue (stimulates menses), cardiac tonic, antispasmodic, nervine, diuretic, and carminative. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nWe also make a Motherwort tincture. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Eidon Mineral Enriched Moisturizing Lotion 16oz
Short description: Eidon Mineral Enriched Moisturizing Lotion \n \nEidon has pioneered a Silica, Sulfur (MSM), Magnesium, Zinc and Copper enhanced moisturizing lotion utilizing Silica's important role in maintaining the body's connective tissue - including skin, hair and nails. \n \nThis unique blend of herbal and botanical oils, combined with the absorbent and therapeutic qualities of Eidon’s Ionic Minerals, penetrates quickly without greasiness. Silica's water bonding qualities attract and hold moisture to the skin. MSM is known as the "beauty mineral" because it keeps the complexion clear and youthful. Magnesium, Zinc and Copper have been added to help calm, soothe and rejuvenate the skin. This lotion softens and adds elasticity to dry and/or aging skin. Use as a moisturizer, foundation base, shaving cream, or hair conditioner. \n \nEidon's Mineral Enriched Moisturizing Lotion is free from colorings, perfumes, sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS), sodium laureth sulfate (SLES), parabens, lanolin, phthalates, alcohol, soap and formaldehyde. \n \nIngredients: \nPurified Water, Polawax (plant derived), Stearic Acid, Grapefruit Seed Extract, Glycerin, Sunflower Oil, Silica-Sulfur-Magnesium-Zinc-Copper Blend, Hops Extract, Chamomile Extract, Comfrey Extract, Peruvian Salt, Argan Oil, Avocado Oil, Jojoba Oil, Hemp Oil, Grape Seed Extract, Orange and Tangerine Essential Oils, Aloe Vera, Vitamin E. \n \nFor external use only. Vegan and Gluten Free. Produced with no animal by-products and without animal testing. Thoroughly tested on humans! \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Resveratrol Elite 60 Capsules
Short description:
\n \nResveratrol Elite 60 capsules \n \nResveratrol is an anti-aging supplement that’s good for your heart, mind, and cellular health. But traditional resveratrol has low bioavailability. This formula contains trans-resveratrol in a hydrogel coating to improve bioavailability up to a whopping 10x! That is combined with a high-bioavailability form of quercetin—a phytonutrient that’s good for your heart and immune system. This advanced formula allows your body to make the most of these super-nutrients' health benefits. \n \nFound in red grapes, as well as Japanese knotweed, resveratrol is a plant compound that promotes healthy aging and overall health. Quercetin is a bioflavonoid nutrient that supports cardiovascular health and encourages a healthy immune response. \n
Supplement Facts
\n
Serving Size 1 Vegetarian Capsule
\n
Amount Per Serving
\n
\n
Resveratrol Elite™ 222 mg
\n
Proprietary Blend Providing 18% trans-resveratrol (40 mg) [from Japanese knotweed (root)], 35% galactomannans (77 mg) [from fenugreek (seed)]
\n
\n
Bio-Quercetin® Proprietary Blend 9 mg
\n
Providing 35% quercetin (3 mg) [from Japanese sophora concentrate (flower bud), 30% galactomannans (2.7 mg) [from fenugreek (seed)]
\n
\n
Other ingredients: microcrystalline cellulose, vegetable cellulose (capsule), sunflower lecithin, sunflower oil, silica, vegetable stearate, calcium High Bioavailability silicate.
\n
\n
Dosage and Use
\n
Take one (1) capsule daily, or as recommended by a healthcare practitioner.
\n
\n \nKEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN \n \nWhen using nutritional supplements, please consult with your physician if you are undergoing treatment for a medical condition or if you are pregnant or lactating. \n \n
\n
These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: L-Lysine 620mg 100 Capsules
Short description:
L-Lysine 620mg 100 Capsules \n
\n \nLysine, a building block for protein, is an essential amino acid, which means it is not produced by our bodies. Therefore, it has to be obtained through our diet. Lysine helps encourage a healthy stress response and helps inhibit glycation, which can play a role in a variety of age-related factors. Among its potential health benefits, lysine supplementation has been shown to increase calcium absorption and retention. L-Lysine Benefits: Supports healthy nitrogen balance, Promotes healthy calcium metabolism, Encourages a healthy stress response, Helps inhibit glycation. \n \nSupplement Facts: \nServing Size 1 Vegetarian Capsule \nAmount Per Serving: \nL-Lysine (as L-Lysine HCl) 620 mg \nOther ingredients: vegetable cellulose (capsule), vegetable stearate, L-leucine. \n \nDosage and Use: Take one (1) capsule one to three times daily on an empty stomach, or as recommended by a healthcare practitioner. \n \n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Citicoline (CDP-Choline) 60 Capsules
Short description:
Citicoline (CDP-Choline) 60 Capsules
\n
\nCholine is needed by our brains to produce acetylcholine, a neurotransmitter that facilitates communication between neurons. Unfortunately, our brain cells absorb less choline as we age—which makes choline supplementation a good idea. Our Citicoline (CDP-Choline) provides a form of choline that readily passes through the blood-brain barrier (BBB) directly into the brain, where cells can easily use it to nourish cellular membranes and support neurotransmitter production. Choline helps use produce a neurotransmitter that facilitates communication between neurons - a basic part of healthy brain function. Citicoline (CDP-Choline) Benefits: encourages the synthesis of neurotransmitters in the brain, supports healthy cognition & attention, and supports overall memory function & mood.
\n
\nSupplement Facts:
\nServing Size 1 Vegetarian Capsule
\nAmount Per Serving:
\nCiticoline (as citicoline monosodium salt) 250mg
\nOther ingredients: vegetable cellulose (capsule), microcrystalline cellulose, silica, vegetable stearate.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: D, L-Phenylalanine 500mg 100 Capsules
Short description: D, L-Phenylalanine 500mg 100 capsules \n \nPhenylalanine is an essential amino acid, which means your body can’t produce sufficient amounts and requires it from an external source. It’s converted to L-tyrosine in the liver, which is then converted into dopamine, norepinephrine and epinephrine (adrenaline) hormones that can become depleted for a variety of reasons. Replenishing norepinephrine in the brain can support brain health. The neurotransmitters produced from phenylalanine supplementation bring a wide range of cognitive health benefits. D, L-Phenylalanine Benefits: supports production of L-tyrosine, which is used to make dopamine, norepinephrine & epinephrine, helps promote healthy mood & sleep, supports healthy cognitive function, and provides protection for brain cells. \n \nSupplement Facts: \nServing Size 1 Vegetarian Capsule \nAmount Per Serving: \nD,L-phenylalanine 500 mg \nOther ingredients: vegetable cellulose (capsule), vegetable stearate, microcrystalline cellulose. \n \nDosage and Use: Take one (1) capsule daily on an empty stomach in the morning, or as recommended by a healthcare practitioner. Best utilized if taken with the co-factors vitamins B6 and C. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

The combination of cilantro and chlorella elicits a potent cleansing action and provides antioxidant support for overall cellular health. The herbal chelating function of cilantro cleanses the system of metals. Cilantro and chlorella work synergistically, increasing effectiveness. Triple Action Cruciferous Vegetable Extract, 60 vegetarian capsules \n
\n \nOur Triple Action Cruciferous Vegetable Extract combines plant extracts derived from leafy green “cruciferous” vegetables. This comprehensive, food-based formula promotes cellular health and already healthy hormone levels. Maintaining healthy hormone levels is essential to any comprehensive whole-body health strategy. This supplement combines extracts of broccoli, cabbage and other phytonutrients to help maintain already healthy hormone levels. Compounds in cruciferous vegetables help maintain already healthy hormone levels and promote DNA health. Triple Action Cruciferous Vegetable Extract Benefits: Offers advanced cellular protection, Promotes healthy DNA, Helps maintain already healthy hormone levels, Promotes liver health & healthy estrogen metabolism via I3C (indole-3-carbinol) and DIM (diindolylmethane) compounds. \n
\n

Name: Kudzu Recovery Anti-Alcohol and Liver Support 750mg 60tablets
Short description: Kudzu Recovery Anti-Alcohol and Liver Support 750mg 60tablets \n \nKudzu (Pueraria lobata) \nThe roots of Kudzu have been used in traditional Chinese herbalism for reducing the negative effects of alcohol. Historically, it was used in formulas used for “drunkenness”. More recently, kudzu root received a lot of mainstream attention due to a Harvard University study on the plant's ability to help decrease consumption of alcohol in human subjects. The study published in Alcoholism: Clinical and Experimental Research, underscores what Chinese herbalism has long known, that kudzu is the premier herb for managing alcohol intake! Kudzu Recovery™ contains a centuries old Chinese formula offering all the benefits of kudzu plus key botanicals to support liver cleansing, balanced blood sugar levels and enhanced energy. \n \nBased on a 350-year old Chinese herbal formula for “drunkenness”, Kudzu Recovery provides a blend of kudzu roots in conjunction with key botanicals including coptis, codonopsis, and ginger, which support liver health, the nervous system, and detoxification processes. This gives the benefits of kudzu while supporting other systems necessary for the healthful management of alcohol intake. \n \nSupplement Facts for 750 mg Tablet: \nServing Size: 2 Tablets \nCalcium (as dibasic calcium phosphate) (31mg) \nProprietary Blend: Kudzu Root Extract, Japanese Raisin Tree Fruit, Coptis Root, Poria sclerotium, Zhu Ling sclerotium, Ginger Root, Bai-Zhu Atractylodes Rhizome, Codonopsis Root, Shen Qu-Massa Fermentata Extract, and Fennel Seed. (1.5g) \nOther Ingredients: microcrystalline cellulose, sorbitol, stearic acid, dibasic calcium phosphate, silica, modified cellulose gum, and magnesium stearate. \n \nSuggested Use: 2 tablets twice daily between meals. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Beet Essence Juice Powder 5.3oz
Short description: Organic Beet Essence Juice Powder 5.3oz \n \nOrganic Beet Essence Juice Powder May Help: \n \n• Fight Off Free Radicals: Beets are a fantastic source of antioxidants, in particular vitamin C, manganese and two carotenoids called lutein and zeaxanthin. \n \n• Reduce Inflammation: Pigments in beets may help reduce inflammation, consequently reducing risk factors for developing everything from heart diseases to cancer. The same pigments may also reduce pain associated with osteoarthritis. \n \n• Protect Vision: Studies have found a link between consuming lutein and zeaxanthin and lowering risk factors for age-related macular degeneration, and it may also help prevent cataracts and retinitis pigmentosa. \n \n• Lower Blood Pressure: Beets can help lower blood pressure, likely due to the high level of nitrates naturally present in the vegetable. Results appear to be short-lived, but long-term change is possible with regular consumption. \n \n• Improve Energy Levels and Physical Performance: Nitrates have also been linked to mitochondrial efficiency. Consuming beet juice on a daily basis may help athletes increase their oxygen use, improve performance and boost endurance. \n \n• Prevent Cognitive Decline: Nitrates once again come into play here by increasing the dilation of blood vessels and promoting blood flow to the brain, especially the frontal lobe, which controls memory and decision-making. \n \n• Cleanse the Liver: Beets contain an amino acid called betaine that may assist in reducing the amount of fat that accumulates in the liver, improving function and helping the liver stay a healthy size. \n \n• Support Detoxification: As toxins build up, our bodies have to work overtime to clear the debris and accomplish routine tasks. Betalain from beets has been shown to trigger the phase of detox that neutralizes and disposes of those toxins. \n \nGreen Foods Beet Essence is most effective when taken on an empty stomach, preferably either 20 minutes before or 2 hours after a meal. Simply stir a single serving (5 grams, or about one teaspoon) of the powder into 6-8 ounces of your favorite cold liquid. Beet Essence is delicious when mixed with water, or you can add it to your favorite fresh juice or smoothie. \n \nUse Beet Essence as a daily complement to your plant-based or omnivore diet, or treat yourself to a healthy boost on those afternoons when you feel your energy flagging. \n \nOur Beet Essence only has two ingredients: organic beet juice powder and organic maltodextrin (derived from tapioca). The powder contains no added salt, sugar, coloring, fillers, animal products, soy, wheat, gluten, corn, yeast or GMOs. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Magnesium Carbonate Powder Raspberry Lemon Flavor 16oz
Short description:
CALM Magnesium Carbonate Powder Raspberry Lemon Flavor 16oz \nfrom Natural Vitality \n \nWe LOVE magnesium for the mood benefits. But the fact is, magnesium is essential for over 300 processes in the body, yet most of us don’t get enough of it. So even if you’re sipping for serenity, know that you’re doing so much more for your well-being. \n \nBALANCED MOOD \nOur favorite benefit of magnesium, of course, is how well it works to support a balanced mood and healthy response to stress. It also eases tension and helps you relax. \n \nNIGHTTIME RELAXATION \nMagnesium helps ease tension so you can relax for a good night’s sleep. \n \nMUSCLE FUNCTION \nWhen we say magnesium is an essential mineral, we mean it. Your muscles need it in order to contract and relax. The means the more active you are, the more you need it to help support healthy muscle function.* \n \nBRAIN & NERVOUS SYSTEM FUNCTION \nMagnesium protects the lining of your nerves and helps your nerves talk to each other. Ultimately, this supports healthy overall nerve and brain function. \n \nCARDIOVASCULAR HEALTH \nAnother reason to love magnesium? Your heart. Not only does it help maintain healthy blood pressure levels, but it’s also required for normal heart contraction. \n \nBONE DENSITY \nKeeping up your daily levels of magnesium helps you maintain healthy bones. When you don’t get enough, your body’s ability to absorb calcium and vitamin D might be impacted. \n \nHelps ease tension with 325 mg magnesium citrate \n \nSupplement Facts: \nServing Size 2 teaspoons \nAmount Per Serving: \nMagnesium carbonate (325 mg) \n \nOther ingredients: citric acid, organic lemon flavor, organic raspberry flavor with other natural flavors, organic stevia (leaf) extract. \n \nMagnesium carbonate and citric acid, when combined with water, create a solution of magnesium citrate. \n
    \n
  • Contains no sugar, fructose, artificial color or flavor.
    • \n
  • Gluten-Free
    • \n
  • Non-GMO Project Verified
    • \n
  • Vegan
    • \n
  • Certified C.L.E.A.N.
    • \n
\n
How to take
\n
\n
\n
\n \nTake daily. Anytime you’re ready to relax, mix up a cup of CALM and enjoy with or without food. \n \nStep 1: Start with half a teaspoon (1g) daily and gradually increase to two leveled teaspoons (4g) per day as needed. Place powder in a glass or mug, add 2-3 oz. of hot or cold water. \n \nStep 2: Let it fizz, then stir until dissolved and clear. \n \nStep 3: Fill the rest of the cup with warm or cold water, and sip! \n \n  \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine. \n \n
\n
\n

Name: SinuOrega Nasal Mist (2oz)
Short description:
SinuOrega Nasal Mist (2oz) is a natural nasal wash powered by potent spice extracts.  These powerful extracts are combined with pure sea salt in a spring water base, the ideal wash and inhalant for the nasal membranes and sinuses. Can be used daily as it is non-addictive. Always free from:  alcohols, polysorbate 80, and sodium chloride. \n \nSinusitis is highly prevalent in the American population and has been found to affect up to 37 million people, which is nearly one of seven Americans.  SinuOrega is a natural nasal wash powered by potent spice extracts.  These powerful extracts are combined with pure sea salt in a spring water base, the ideal wash and inhalant for the nasal membranes and sinuses. \n \nHow to Use: \nInsert nozzle next to inner nasal membrane and gently squirt. Sniff contents deeply. Repeat with each nostril as needed. Temporary burning, stinging, sneezing and nasal discharge may occur. \n
Ingredients: Filtered/purified water, Wild oil of oregano, Sea salt, Clove bud oil, Oil of sage, and Oil of bay leaf
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Nasal Cleansing Pot - Ceramic
Short description:
Nasal Cleansing Pot - Ceramic \n \nFor the cleansing and moisturizing of nasal passages according to the traditional practices of Neti. Benefits: Clear the nasal passages, remove excess mucus, reduce dust and pollen by cleansing nasal passages, and relieve nasal dryness. \n \nAncient Secrets Nasal Cleansing Pot is the ideal answer for cleansing and moisturizing of nasal passages. You need only follow the simple directions inside to prepare the saline solution used to rinse through your nostrils. This gentle and effective technique of nasal irrigation is widely recommended by practitioners of yoga and ayurveda world-wide as a wonderful way to improve your overall feeling of well-being. \n \n(Complete instructions inside package)::1. Prepare the saline solution and fill pot. 2. Tilt your head to the side as shown. 3. Insert spout of nasal cleansing pot gently into the raised nostril creating a seal between Pot and nostril. 4. Raise the nasal cleansing pot slowly to develop a steady flow of saline solution through the upper nostril and out the lower nostril. 5. During the process breathe through your mouth. 6. Upon completion, exhale firmly several times to clear the nasal passages. 7. Reverse the tilt of your head and repeat the process on the other side. \n
Weight 0.64Lb
\n

Name: Baikal Skullcap Root, Organic,1 oz bag
Short description: Baikal Skullcap Root, Organic,1 oz bag of cut and sifted root \n \nBaikal skullcap (Scutellaria baicalensis) is native to North China, Russia, Mongolia, Japan and Siberia and is sometimes referred to as Chinese Skullcap, being a well known Traditional Chinese herb used as a strengthening immune and nerve tonic. The root is anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, antiviral, antioxidant, and a nervine. (Not to be confused with the North American skullcap, Scutellaria laterifolia, in which the leaf and aerial parts are used). \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

\nAs a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It is important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider. These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

\nAs a broad-spectrum cannabinoid extract, in addition to cannabidiol (CBD) and more than 80 other cannabinoids in hemp, Rogue Herbalist products may contain a trace amount of the cannabinoid THC, less than .3%. Much like the consumption of poppy seeds may lead to a positive drug test for opioids, the consumption of certain hemp products may lead to a positive drug test for tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). THC is inherently present in trace amounts in hemp plants. The legal limit of THC in hemp is no more than 0.3%. It is important to understand that the underlying science behind the conversion of certain cannabinoids to other related cannabinoids when consumed is not yet fully understood. If you are a person who is subject to drug testing we strongly suggest consulting your health care provider before consuming any hemp products because individual biochemistry, the potential for the conversion of cannabinoids, and the possibility of trace, but legal, amounts of THC inherent in hemp products are all factors to consider. These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Manuka Honey - Medical Grade MGO 400
Short description:
Medical Grade Manuka is honey with superpowers! Due to its oligosaccharides, the prebiotic activity supports a healthy gut microbiome. Oligosaccharides are carbohydrates that cannot be digested by the human body. Instead, they go right to the large intestine where they act as a prebiotic - food for your good gut bacteria - which offer a wide range of health benefits, including improved microbiome health and a stronger immune system.<sup> </sup>
\n
\nThe gut microbiome is considered healthy when good bacteria outnumber bad bacteria. The acidic environment of the stomach performs an invaluable job in killing many of the bad bacteria before them making it to the intestines where they can affect the bacterial balance. If you have too many harmful gut bacteria, the body may struggle to fight off infection. A large portion of the immune system resides in the gut microbiome, supporting the good bacteria with prebiotic nourishment is an essential part of the body’s ability to mount a strong defense.

Name: Magnesium Glycinate 120 tablets
Short description:
Source Naturals Magnesium Glycinate 120 Tablets
\n
\nMagnesium is one of the most important minerals in the body, but an estimated 75% of Americans are magnesium deficient. Magnesium plays a key role in over 300 enzymatic reactions, including supporting cardiovascular, bone, muscle, energy, and neurotransmitter processes. Source Naturals magnesium is attached ("chelated") to the amino acid glycine. The magnesium glycinate combination enables efficient absorption, the glycinate allowing the magnesium to transfer easily across the intestinal wall. Increased absorption means more usable magnesium for your body's needs.
\n
\nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Magnesium Taurate 90 tablets
Short description:
KAL Magnesium Taurate is magnesium chelated with the amino acid taurine, designed to create a powerhouse, bioavailable form of magnesium. Taken regularly, magnesium taurate may offer targeted support for cardiovascular and nerve health, as well as healthy muscle function, including one of your hardest-working muscles—your heart. The "Plus" in this formula is co-enzyme vitamin B-6, which is thought to work synergistically with magnesium and may help support the formation of red blood cells and a calm, healthy nervous system.

Name: Baikal Skullcap Tincture 2oz
Short description: Baikal Skullcap 2oz Tincture \n \nBaikal skullcap (Scutellaria baicalensis) is native to North China, Russia, Mongolia, Japan and Siberia and is sometimes referred to as Chinese Skullcap, being a well known Traditional Chinese herb used as a strengthening immune and nerve tonic. The root is anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, antiviral, antioxidant, and a nervine. (Not to be confused with the North American skullcap, Scutellaria laterifolia, in which the leaf and aerial parts are used). \n \nThis Baikal Skullcap Tincture is part of our Artisan Collection of tinctures and products that we make on site in Morrisville, Vermont, and is made from USDA Organic Dried Roots. Extracted in 70% Organic Cane Alcohol & Reverse Osmosis Maple Water. Herb Strength Ratio: 1:2.5. Take 30 drops in water or juice, 1 – 3 times daily, or as needed. \n \nYou may also be interested in our Baikal Skullcap cut and sifted dried roots in bulk. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Short description: Bentonite clay powder is a naturally occurring by product of volcanic ash exposed to wind and water. \n \nIt is added to natural body powders, usually in combination with corn starch or orris root powder. Name: Bitter Orange Peel, Organic, 1oz bag
Short description: Bitter Orange Peel, Organic, 1oz bag \n \nBitter Orange (Citrus x aurantium) is an evergreen tree with long spines, aromatic flowers, and orange fruits whose membranes are sour and bitter. Bitter orange is used as a flavoring agent in many foods and beverages, including marinades, jams, and liqueurs. Our organic bitter orange peel can also be infused to make soaps, body scrubs, and skin care products. It is also used as a flavoring agent in many foods, and for its fragrance in bath and body care products.  As a flavoring agent it can be used in a wide variety of foods and is used in liqueurs (most notably Triple Sec), desserts, candies, gelatins and puddings. It is used to cover up the taste of pharmaceuticals, as well as being a key ingredient in marmalade. The peel is used in teas, adding a citrusy aroma and reddish-brown color splash.  \n \nPrecautions \nMay affect the metabolism of certain drugs. If taking medications consult under the supervision of a qualified healthcare practitioner before use. We recommend that you consult with a qualified healthcare practitioner before using herbal products, particularly if you are pregnant, nursing, or on any medications. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nWe also carry Grapefruit Peel. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Black Walnut Hulls, Organic,1oz. bag
Short description: Black Walnut Hulls, Organic, 1oz bag \nJuglans nigra \n \nThe tree is Black Walnut (Juglans nigra), but before the Walnuts are ripe they are green. This is the stage of harvest while the medicinal constituents are at their highest. The black walnut is covered with a green pulp until autumn, when it falls to the ground and turns black. Black Walnut Hull is the shell, or coating of the nut inside. Black Walnut is a classic anthelmintic herb, killing parasites, bacteria, fungus, and more. It has an affinity for the thyroid and is helpful with constipation. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. Name: Blessed Thistle, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Blessed Thistle, Organic, 1oz. bag. \nCnicus benedictus \n \nBitter in flavor, blessed thistle is commonly used in extracts and cordials. Blessed thistle has been revered since the Middle Ages in Europe for its use as a digestive stimulant and nutritive tonic. This herb is approved by the German Commission E for its ability to increase appetite and support the digestive process and is also an approved food additive in the United States for its flavoring of liqueurs such as Benedictine. Blessed thistle is considered energetically cooling and drying with a bitter taste. Another common name of blessed thistle is holy thistle. Because the plant had a reputation in Medieval Europe as a cure for the plague and "other diseases of melancholy," it also became known as holy thistle and St. Benedict's thistle. \n \nPrecautions \nPersons with allergies to other members of the Asteraceae family (such as feverfew, chamomile, or Echinacea species) should exercise caution with Blessed Thistle as allergic cross-reactivity to Asteraceae plants is common. May reduce the effectiveness of H2-blockers and proton pump inhibitors. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Cascara Sagrada Bark Powder, Wild harvested, 1oz. bag
Short description: Cascara Sagrada Bark Powder, Wild harvested, 1oz. bag \nFrangula purshiana \n \nThis aged bark is a mild laxative that affects the colon, spleen, stomach, and liver. The bitterness stimulates the digestive secretions of the gastrointestinal system including the liver, gallbladder, stomach, and pancreas. It is considered one of the safest tonic-laxative herbs and can be used on a daily basis for chronic constipation if necessary. It is also useful for colitis, hemorrhoids, liver failure, and jaundice. \n \nCascara sagrada is a large shrub found in the Pacific Northwest and western Canada. The plant was given its common name meaning “sacred bark” by Spanish missionaries who were awed after witnessing the herb’s effectiveness. Traditionally, Frangula purshiana was utilized by indigenous tribes for its healthful properties and as an occasional, mild laxative. Our cascara sagrada powder is milled from bark after one year of aging and can be made into tablets or used in extract making. The herb is harvested in the form of quills and pieces of bark, allowed to age at least a year before use in laxative preparations. Cascara sagrada is never to be used fresh and must be aged for at least a year to break down its anthrone chemicals.  \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nWe also sell Cascara Sagrada Bark in cut and sifted form if you are looking for a non-powdered form. \n \nPrecautions \nNot for use in pregnancy or lactation except under the supervision of a qualified healthcare practitioner. Contraindicated with intestinal obstruction, abdominal pain, or any inflammatory condition of the intestines. Not for use in excess of 8 days unless under the supervision of a qualified healthcare practitioner. We recommend that you consult with a qualified healthcare practitioner before using herbal products, particularly if you are pregnant, nursing, or on any medications. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Corn Silk, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Corn Silk, Organic, 1oz. bag \nZea mays \n \nCorn silk is a diuretic with an affinity for the kidneys and urinary tract, especially when heat is present. Considered energetically cooling and demulcent, corn silk is sometimes used in traditional folk herbalism as a tonic herb. Corn silk is typically prepared fresh as a tincture or can be dried and used in herbal tea blends and as a stand-alone infusion. Most people are familiar with corn silk as the glossy strands that stubbornly cling to a fresh ear of corn. Although most people toss this material, dried cornsilk makes a tasty tea since it contains the same compounds found in mint and in thyme. Be aware, however, that corn silk may increase the effects of diuretics, such as furosemide (Lasix). \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nYou may also be interested in our Urinary Tract Health tea. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Dandelion Root Roasted Granules, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Roasted Dandelion Root Granules, Organic, 1oz. bag \nTaraxacum offinale \n \nRoasted dandelion root has a long history of being used as a coffee substitute, particularly during times of economic hardship or coffee shortages. Dandelion root has a similar appearance and texture to coffee beans and when roasted, it develops a similar flavor profile. During World War II, for example, coffee was rationed and dandelion root was often used as an alternative. The practice of using dandelion root as a coffee substitute dates back even further, with some sources claiming that it was used during the American Civil War and in the Great Depression. \n \nDandelion root coffee is made by harvesting the roots of the dandelion plant, washing and drying them, roasting them until they are dark brown and then grounding them. The resulting powder can be used to brew a beverage that is said to have a similar taste to coffee. Some people claim that dandelion root coffee is less bitter and has a slightly sweeter taste than traditional coffee. Dandelion is high in antioxidants, minerals and inulin, a type of soluble fiber. We also offer local Dandelion Root from Foster Farm Botanicals as well as Dandelion Tincture. \n \nNote that this product is the Roasted Dandelion Root GRAINS or GRANULES, so is a more finely ground Roasted Dandelion Root. We also have a chunkier cut and sifted version of the Roasted Dandelion Root. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Frankincense Resin, Organic, 1oz bag
Short description: Frankincense Resin, Organic, 1 oz. bag \nBoswellia sacra \n \nFrankincense resin is gathered by making incisions in the small, deciduous tree, Boswellia sacra. The yellow-hued pitch is often used as incense or in perfumery. Frankincense has been considered an herb of spirituality with lore dating back thousands of years. The aromatic resin can be used alone or blended into incense formulas. \n \nFrankincense and the oil produced from it has been known for its magical powers and its ability to improve communication with the creator in the Middle East for thousands of years before it was made a gift to Christ by the Magi. There are over 52 references to it in the Bible. Egyptian records show a great many references to it including its use in cosmetics, perfumes and as an embalming agent. The harvest of gums and resins takes place during the dry season, as they are easily damaged by rain. A number of incisions are made into the bark, and the gum resins are allowed to ooze out and solidify for a few weeks. The harvesters then return to each tree to collect the resin. The resins are then transported to local villages where they are further dried in the shade. Frankincense is a member for the Burseraceae family. \n \nBoswellia is a cousin of Frankincense, you may be interested in Boswellia Tincture. This tree resin extract is a potent source of various anti-inflammatory compounds. \n \nWe also carry Frankincense Essential Oil. It smells divine! \n \nThis Frankincense Resin is sold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Gum Arabic Powder, Organic, 1oz. bag
Short description: Gum Arabic Powder, Organic, 1oz. bag \nAcacia senegal \n \nGum Arabic is a plant-derived fiber that's often used as a natural thickening agent or binder to hold ingredients together, helping to stabilize baked goods, herbal medicines and emulsions in skin care, adding natural soluble fiber to recipes. It is also sometimes called acacia gum or acacia powder, and is a fibrous product made from the natural hardened sap of two types of wild Acacia trees. Due to its fiber content, it has been traditionally used to feed beneficial probiotics in the gut, for IBS like symptoms, to enhance fullness and regulate cholesterol. There has also been some research into gum arabic's possible ability to improve the bioavailability of dietary supplements and CBD. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Andrographis Tincture 2oz.
Short description: Andrographis Tincture 2oz. \nAndrographis paniculata \n \nAndrographis is a powerful bitter that may be used to stimulate immune function and support a healthy inflammation response. The incredible bitterness of this plant means it may have a blood sugar lowering effect. It should only be used in smaller doses; large doses may cause griping (gastrointestinal pain & constipation). Name: Psyllium Husk Powder 1 oz bag
Short description: Psyllium husk is demulcent and helps to provide support for the digestive track. Our psyllium powder is ground from Plantago ovata husks and can be used in cooking as a thickening agent.  Psyllium is mucilaginous and swells up when introduced to water. The ground or whole husk must always be taken with at least 1 full glass of water. Because of its rather neutral flavor it may be added to most food dishes. \n \nPrecautions \nTake with at least 250 mL (8 oz.) of water. Taking this product without adequate fluid may cause it to swell and block your throat or esophagus and may cause choking. Do not take this product if you have difficulty in swallowing. Other drugs should be taken one hour prior to consumption of psyllium or several hours after consumption, as psyllium may reduce the absorption of certain drugs due to the mucilage content and the increased speed of passage through the intestines. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. Our psyllium powder is ground from Plantago ovata husks and can be used in cooking as a thickening agent.  Psyllium is mucilaginous and swells up when introduced to water. The ground or whole husk must always be taken with at least 1 full glass of water. Because of its rather neutral flavor it may be added to most food dishes. \n \nPrecautions \nTake with at least 250 mL (8 oz.) of water. Taking this product without adequate fluid may cause it to swell and block your throat or esophagus and may cause choking. Do not take this product if you have difficulty in swallowing. Other drugs should be taken one hour prior to consumption of psyllium or several hours after consumption, as psyllium may reduce the absorption of certain drugs due to the mucilage content and the increased speed of passage through the intestines. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Sweet Annie, Vermont Grown Organic, 1 oz bag
Short description: Sweet Annie, Vermont Grown Organic, 1 oz bag \nArtemisia annua \n \nOur Sweet Annie is organically grown by Foster Farm Botanicals in East Calais, Vermont and it is the highest quality around. Some of Sweet Annie's actions are antibacterial, antiparasitic, antimarial, antiseptic, bitter and carminative. Sweet Annie contains artemisinin, which recent studies suggest exhibit antibacterial activity against certain tick-borne pathogens, including the causative agent of Lyme disease, Borrelia burgdorferi, as well as Babesia spp. It's anti-inflammatory and immunomodulatory effects could also aid in reducing inflammation and supporting the immune system in response to vector-borne infections. It has also traditionally been used to support indigestion and infections of the digestive system. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nYou may also be interested in Mugwort in bulk or tincture, another member of the Artemisia family. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Yaupon American Fire Roasted, Organic, 1 oz bag
Short description: Yaupon American Fire Roasted, Organic, 1 oz bag \nIlex vomitoria \n \nPure Yaupon Holly, dried and roasted over an open flame.  Naturally caffeinated, organic.  Our Fire Roasted Warrior's blend is the boldest of the Yaupon Brother's teas, with a slightly smoky flavor. Our Yaupon teas are a true labor of love. Each leaf is hand-plucked, carefully dried or fire-roasted, graded and milled, and hand-packed in our facility in Edgewater, Florida. We don’t outsource any aspect of production, because we won’t compromise on quality. Yaupon Brothers has a policy of transparency, because we’re proud of our craft and we want to share it with the world. Quality combines with nature’s special touch in East Central Florida, where Yaupon trees are ancient and very special. One of the unique things about Yaupon is that it is tannin-free, so it’s naturally sweet and impossible to over-steep. \n \nBrewing Instructions: Brew at 212 F and let steep for five minutes. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nYou may also be interested in our other Yaupon Brothers Teas, a few different flavors sold in cardboard tubes of 16 tea bags each. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Solomon’s Seal Granules, 1 oz bag
Short description: Solomon’s Seal Granules, 1 oz bag \nPolygonatum biflorum  \n \nSolomon’s Seal is truly a remarkable remedy for the muscular and skeletal system. I have personally used it to heal my injured back and given it to many clients with success. According to Matthew Wood: “It is suited to a wide range of problems affecting the joints, ligaments, tendons, and muscles. It tightens or loosens tendons and attachments (depending on which is needed), strengthens and repairs joint damage, soothes…many kinds of arthritis in the joints, and works nicely with repetitive-injury problems such as tennis elbow, jogger’s knee, and carpal-tunnel syndrome”(The Practice of Traditional Western Herbalism pp. 191). These granules particularly make a nice oil or salve to rub on aches and pain. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. Name: Stinging Nettles 101 Workshop
Short description:
Explore the World of Stinging Nettles with Us! \nMay 18th 9:30am - Noon
\nReady for an exciting journey into the realm of Stinging Nettles? Come along with us for an immersive class that promises both adventure and learning! We'll kick things off at the herb shop, then head to a local farm to gather fresh Stinging Nettle tops. Back at the shop, get ready to unlock the full potential of this incredible plant as we delve into its medicinal and culinary wonders. \n \nDuring our time together, we'll whip up some nourishing nettle tea, prepare batches for future use in the dehydrator, and create a delicious Fresh Nettle Puree—ideal for freezing and adding a nutritious boost to your favorite dishes or herbal remedies. \n \nDon't forget to bring your gloves and a trusty basket or bucket if you're keen on taking some nettles home. And for those with a green thumb, we've got you covered! Bring your own bucket, and we'll happily send you off with nettles to plant. Just a heads up—they're known to thrive, so be prepared for a garden takeover! \n \nFor just $40 per person, you'll have the chance to harvest as many nettles as you can carry and gain valuable insights into the fascinating world of this remarkable plant. Don't miss out on this opportunity—reserve your spot today!

Name: Silk Tree Bark, 1 oz bag
Short description: Silk Tree Bark, Wild harvested, 1 oz bag \nAlbizia julibrissin \n \nThe silk tree, also known as the mimosa tree, is commonly referred to as ‘happiness tree’ in Traditional Chinese Medicine due to its nervine properties and promotion of positive emotional state. The bark can be used in the form of a tea or tincture and can also be powered to make capsules or external pastes. Consuming as a tea before bed can soothe the nerves to promote a night of sound sleep. Traditionally it has also been used to support someone processing grief or loss and is often combined with Hawthorn for this purpose. Additionally, this bark is used for general skin irritation and can be incorporated in skin care routines in the form of serums, tinctures, and creams. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nYou may also be interested in Hawthorn Berries.  \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Short description: Mullein Leaf Powder, 1 oz bag \n \nMullein (Verbascum thapsus) is a common weed that acts as a powerful expectorant and demulcent for respiratory complaints. It soothes inflamed passageways of respiratory and urinary passageways. Helpful with dry coughs and hoarseness.   It has a mild action on the lymphatic system and can be combined with stronger lymphatic herbs. \n \nNote that this is the powdered form of mullein leaf, we also carry Mullein in cut and sifted in bulk. Name: Partridgeberry, 1 oz bag
Short description: Partridgeberry, 1 oz bag \nMitchella repens \nWildharvested \n \n \nPartridgeberry is a creeping, evergreen plant Native to eastern North America that can be found growing in woodland habitats and along streambanks. Many indigenous people of North America used partridgeberry as an emmenagogue, astringent, diuretic, parturient and styptic. It has also traditionally been used for urinary tract disorders including easing infections, interstitial cystitis, and BPH as a diuretic and astringent. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. Name: Pipsissewa, 1 oz bag
Short description: Pipsissewa, 1 oz bag \nChimaphila umbellata \nWildharvested \n \nPipsissewa, Native to southern Canada and the northern United States, has astringent leaves that are also bitter and cool. The leaves have an affinity for the bladder, heart, small intestine and spleen. Medicinal properties include being used as a diuretic, astringent, alterative, aperient, and a bitter tonic. Pipsissewa herb can be decocted as tea, extracted, or prepared for topical application. Michael Tierra, in The Way of Herbs, writes of using Pipsissewa for urinary inflammations in a formula that includes two parts pipsissewa, one part uva ursi, half a part marshamallow root, and one quarter part ginger. Other traditional uses include arthritis and rheumatic conditions. \n \nYou may also be interested in our UT Balance Tincture.  \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: Reishi Mushroom Red Powder, Organic, 1 oz bag
Short description: Reishi Mushroom Red Powder, Organic, 1 oz bag \nGanoderma Lucidum  \n \nReishi Mushroom is sometimes called “the mushroom of immortality” because of its powerful adaptogenic qualities. Scientific research into the compounds responsible for Reishi mushroom activity began in the 1970’s in China and Japan. Scientists discovered highly active beta-(1-3)(1-6)-glucans with the ability to potentiate innate immunity by activating immune cells. Also discovered were secondary metabolites called triterpenoids which were present in significant amounts and sets Reishi apart from all the other medicinal mushrooms. We also offer Vermont Reishi Tincture that is very popular. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. Name: Mucuna Powder, Organic, 1 oz bag
Short description: Mucuna Powder, Organic, 1 oz bag \nMucuna pruriens \n \nMucuna pruriens seed assists in brain function, libido, and supporting muscle growth. Mucuna pruriens contains high concentrations of L-Dopa, a neurotransmitter that prompts a positive mental state of action and assertiveness. Considered energetically warming in nature, mucuna seeds have a long history of use in Ayurveda and traditional Unani healing practices. Referred to as kapikacchu in Ayurveda, mucuna was employed for thousands of years as a tridoshic herb. Both sweet and bitter, kapikacchu was traditionally seen in Ayurveda as a building herb with an affinity for the nervous system, brain, and reproductive system. In Traditional Chinese Medicine, mucuna was viewed as a deeply nourishing herb and was often employed as an adaptogen to enhance overall wellbeing. Traditional Ayurvedic preparations of mucuna bean including mixing the powder with ghee or milk and honey. The powder can even be added to smoothies for a healthful kick. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: White Oak Bark, 1 oz bag
Short description: White Oak Bark, 1 oz bag \nQuercus alba \n \nQuercus alba is native to eastern and central North America. A distinguished hardwood, white oak is named after the light color of its finished wood. White oak bark is astringent and used for its beneficial qualities. White oak bark can be used in baths, washes, infusions, and tinctures. Being astringent in nature thanks to the tannins it contains, it can help to tighten and tone the tissues of the digestive system, aiding in problems such as diarrhea. It's toning qualities may also help in the vascular system with issues such as varicose veins. It's diuretic qualities bring support to the kidneys and bladder. White Oak Bark is also a source of iron and vitamin B12. It also has a history of being used as an antiseptic, antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory. It has traditionally been used as a gargle for sore throats. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: White Pine Bark, 1 oz bag
Short description: White Pine Bark, 1 oz bag \nPinus strobus  \n \nWhite pine, also known as cluster pine and maritime pine, is a species of pine native to the Mediterranean region, particularly the coastlines of France, Italy, Portugal and Spain. While the timber is important in the forestry industry, the thick, reddish bark is harvested for its abundant collection of antioxidant compounds. In fact, white pine bark is available as an over-the-counter supplement blend marketed as Pycnogenol®. The naturopath and herbalist Dr. Aviva Romm writes about Pine Bark studies showing its effectiveness for reduction of pain from endometriosis. White Pine Bark is also a common ingredient in cough syrups and tea blends formulated for congestion. Try it in tea blends, with its slightly bitter but pleasant flavor. White Pine Bark is rich in vitamin C (just like it's needles) and is also antiseptic, helping to support immune and respiratory function. \n \nWe also carry capsules of Pycnogenol® French Maritime Pine Bark Extract. \n \nSold in 1oz. quantities. If you want multiple ounces, just add multiple quantities. \n \nThese statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult your herbalist or healthcare provider before introducing any herbs or supplements into your routine.

Name: St. John's Wort Oil
Short description: St. John's Wort Oil \n \nSt. John's Wort Flowering Tops infused in Organic Coconut Oil. We harvested these flowers at their peak of potency from right here at our Rogue gardens in Morrisville, Vermont. They were sun infused while still fresh, turning the oil a beautiful reddish pink color. Coconut oil hardens to a nice salve consistency at cooler temps and will melt to liquid at warmer temperatures; you can even keep in the fridge if you'd like to keep firm in hot summer temperatures. \n \nSt. John's Wort oil is anti-inflammatory and applied topically is helpful for pain, nerve damage, bruises, swelling, sprains, burns, and rashes. Name: Magnesium Flakes 1.65 LB
Short description:
Magnesium Flakes 1.65 LB (26.4 oz)
\n
\nPure Magnesium Flakes. Super Concentrated. Soak in luxury to relax and rejuvenate body and soul with quality magnesium flakes from the ancient Zechstein Seabed.
\n
\nPure Magnesium Flakes are highly concentrated crystals of magnesium chloride sources from the Ancient Zechstein Seabed in the Netherlands. Nothing added and nothing removed. Restore and Refresh your body and mind by using these flakes in a full bath or foot soak. One cup of flakes contains approximately 90grams of magnesium chloride and numerous naturally occurring trace elements from ancient seawater.
\n
\nDirections: Add 1-2 cups of flakes to the bathtub or footbath, then soak for a minimum of 20 minutes. For best results, the temperature of the magnesium bath should be warm, about 101F to 105F, rather than hot.
\n
\nFor external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Keep out of reach of children. If irritation, redness, or discomfort occurs, discontinue use and consult a licensed health care practitioner.
\n
